results.description:
It's no surprise to find plenty of gothic touches in British author Fowler's debut mystery, the first in a series, given the renown of his horror fiction (Rune , etc.). When 80-year-old police detective Arthur Bryant gets blown up in an explosion at the North London Peculiar Crimes Unit headquarters, his longtime partner, John May, investigates his death. After some long, lecturing dialogue and an early chapter told from the viewpoint of a character who turns out to be of no consequence, the author reaches the core of his story—a flashback to the duo's first case during the London Blitz. In late 1940, the Palace Theatre is staging a production of Orpheus in the Underworld when the body of a dancer is found, sans feet. From this point forward, the intrigues of the theater murders, which decimate the cast, create considerable drama. The potency of Greek myth, conjured up by the opera being staged, is skillfully played out in the detectives' theories about the killer. The dynamic between May and Bryant makes for compelling reading, while the hubris of a police underling, Sidney Biddle, provides additional tension. Both past and present plots reach satisfying resolutions. Now that Fowler has set the stage, no doubt his second Bryant and May mystery will get off to a better start.

Agent, Howard Morhaim. (June ) Publishers Weekly
results.name: Full Dark House, by Christopher Fowler

Mobile growth + pizza + beer - you know the drill! 

We're assembling an all-star panel of experts in mobile to share their experiences growing their app. We'll start the evening off with pizza and beer, then drop into a panel discussion moderated by Adam Lovallo from Grow.co, and wrap things up after audience Q&A with a social hour.

During the panel, we'll go in-depth on best practices for user acquisition, retention, and growth; deep linking and discoverability; channels and strategies for organic growth.

The Plan

7.00pm - Welcome, introductions

8.00pm - Social Hour

The People 
Adelyn Zhou, Founder & CEO, Alight Labs

The Sponsors
Headquartered in New York and with offices in three states, Hometeam transforms the in-home care and aging experience by providing elderly clients with personalized care planning, expert caregiver matching, custom mobile technology, and proactive case management to improve older adults’ health and well-being while giving their families peace of mind. For more information, visit hometeamcare.com

mParticle is the easiest and most complete way to manage app data. With one lightweight SDK, mParticle's platform enables marketers and app developers to collect app data once and connect to any marketing, analytics and data warehousing platform without changing code or waiting for app store approval. Improve stability and security within your app while moving faster with user growth and engagement initiatives.

Branch provides free deep linking technology to mobile app developers and marketers. We're on a mission to help you grow your business through deep linking, and allow users to discover content inside mobile apps. In the last year, Branch has gone from powering deep linking for 6 million users to more than 1 billion users.

Grow.co is a community of growth marketing professionals and brands, comprised of more than 7,000 acquisition and retention-oriented professionals. We serve the community through industry summits, a weekly newsletter, a jobs board, and an online forum.

Mobile Growth meetups are powered by Branch and Grow.co

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-behind-the-scenes-the-society-of-illustrators-tickets-21386943925?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a behind-the-scenes tour of the Society of Illustrators, the oldest non-profit dedicated to promoting the art of illustration.

Since it’s founding, The Society of Illustrators has served as a hub for prominent illustrators such as Norman Rockwell, Howard Pyle, and N.C. Wyeth to name a few. Today the Society continues to play an important role as a center for illustrators to discuss, demonstrate and exhibit their work, contribute to future artists and to the community at large.

Our experience of this 115 year old society, led by its Past President and Collections Manager, will include a visit to its Museum of American Illustration, permanent collections, and members-only library.

Afterward, we'll grab food and drinks in the Hall of Fame dinning room!

results.description:
The Bi Book Club meets once a month to discuss bi-themed books and the issues they raise. Dinner after nearby-we usually go to Village Den on Greenwich Ave behind the Center. 

The book for our Thurs Feb 11 & March 10 meetings is the award-winning fiction novel The Lunatic, the Lover, and the Poet by Myrlin A. Hermes-now on sale at BGSQD

The Lunatic, the Lover, and the Poet is Shakespeare turned topsy turvy: a bisexual love-triangle inspired by Shakespeare′s own sonnets, featuring a sexy young Hamlet. Very readable--no olde English. We're discussing the first half of this book in Feb and the second half in March.

Come and join the discussion even if you havent read the book because we read paragraphs from the book aloud and discuss them.


Note: The Shakespeare Sonnets, and Shakespeare, were bisexual.

After the book discussion we'll be doing a bi T-shirt photo shoot to make a photographic record of my collection, before it is donated to the Center archive. Come bi to model or to refold T-shirts. We need models sizes M-3X.

Next book: The Lunatic, the Lover, and the Poet by Myrlin A. Hermes-2nd half. Shakespeare turned topsy turvy: a clever bisexual mashup between a sexy young Hamlet and characters from the sonnets. Very readable--no olde English. Note: The Sonnets, and Shakespeare, were bisexual.

Deciding Books: We will be voting on what books we want to read next, so check our lists of Bisexual Book Award finalists for some ideas.

Venue: Bureau of General Services Queer Division Bookstore at the LGBT Center, 2nd fl. Rm. 210, phone (646) 457-0859.

Getting Books: We urge you to purchase your print copy at BGSQD and support the only LGBT bookstore in New York City. Especially since they are hosting us in their space! If they are out of stock, put in your special order.

Bi Book Club meets 2nd Thursdays 6:30-8pm. Dinner after nearby-we usually go to Village Den on Greenwich Ave behind the Center.

Fees: Donation to help pay rent

Questions? Email fuscialadybug (at) netzero (dot) com or call[masked]

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
We are back after a long break!

Jim Savage will present Analogy Weighting, an easy-to-deploy method that helps modelers train time-series models on the most relevant data. In doing so, the method frees modelers from the question of what the most optimal look-back window should be, while typically improving out-of-sample predictive performance. He will present applications to forecasting macroeconomic variables, as well as portfolio volatility during the[masked] crisis. 

Jim is an applied economist, data scientist, and head of Modeling at Lendable, a frontier markets finance start-up. He recently moved to New York from Australia, where he worked at the Grattan Institute, a think-tank, and at the Australian Treasury. Last year, he was a fellow in the University of Chicago's Data Science for Social Good summer fellowship (2016 applications close Feb 1!).


Please RSVP with you real name for ISE Building Security.

I hope to see many of you in February.

Eric
results.name: Macroeconomic Forecasting using Analogy Weighting in Stan

With distilleries blossoming throughout the borough and some of the world’s top mixologists calling Brooklyn home, Brooklyn has quickly become the epicenter of creative drinkmaking. results.description:
MakeIt NYC is back with regular meetings this February, and we're getting things rebooted with a terrific slate of presenters, a great new location, and an amazing new sponsor (and, oh yes, giveaways and swag)! This month: MICROCHIP!!! Thimble, The LED Artist, BotFactory and more. UPDATE: Hackaday! Pizza and refreshments! Just sign up already, or read on for more details.

We have a new sponsor, presenter and friend of MakeIT NYC - Microchip Technology Inc. Microchip is the company behind the ubiquitous PIC microcontroller families, about a bazillion other types of electronic components, and they're the new home of the guts of your Arduino, too. Karen Drucker and her team join us to tell us about the high-octane  chipKIT Wi-FIRE Development Board. And who knows? You might get a souvenir to take home with you.


Say thank you to Hackaday, purchaser of tonight's pizza, #1 Hacker news-site and facilitator of The Hackaday Prize.  Sophi Kravitz joins us to talk about The Hackaday Prize where over $500k was awarded in 2015 for humanitarian projects. She'll also discuss Hackaday.io, possibly the funnest (and productive) place on the internet for hardware folks to hang out- it's a project sharing platform with over 120k (yes 120,000!) community members. 


Now, wouldn't it be great if there was something like Blue Apron, but for Makers? And who needs food when there's a hot serving of cool hardware projects shipped to your door every month? That's what Thimble is about. Oscar Pedroso is going to join us and talk about his inspiration, his experience with getting Thimble off the ground, and what a successful Kickstarter campaign is all about. Thimble is funded like a 1000%, but why not check it out and get them to, say, 2000%?

We'll also be joined by Akimitsu Sadoi, know by many as The LED Artist. Aki is, in a sentence, where engineering excellence and artistic creativity intersect. His designs are just lovely, and I was lucky that he allowed us to experiment with one of them at PCB:NG. Oh, and his A60 just happens to employ a Microchip PIC - what a crazy coincidence! If you ever needed advice about LEDs, he's your man.

And if that wasn't enough,  BotFactory, who joined us last September, are back to update us (and show us!)  Squink, their desktop circuit fabrication system. Man, something like that could put certain companies out of business. We promise not to get all cobra and mongoose on stage.


All this and more! See you there.
results.name: MakeIt February

This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Signing Up: Please sign up to the waitlist. After 48 hours I will move people from the waitlist to the going list at which time I will ask you for your prepayment. We have a total of 8 spots for this meal.


Prepay: I am asking everyone to pay the full cost of the meal in advance. The restaurant charges my credit card prior to the meal so all you have to do is show up and eat. Any drinks you order at dinner will be paid for by you at the time of dinner. The total cost (food + tax + tip) is $335. Venmo is preferred but Paypal and Chase Quickpay are ok as well.

Restaurant: In my opinion this is the best restaurant in NYC and I'm very excited to be going back. The restaurant has 18 seats (9 per seating) and everyone is served at once. The kitchen is right in front of you so in addition to the company you can watch the chefs cook. 

Chef’s Table at Brooklyn Fare, Brooklyn’s only three Michelin-starred restaurant, is unlike any other. Settle in to the kitchen counter at this intimate 18 seat space for a unique dining experience featuring the cuisine of Chef Cesar Ramirez. The 15-plus course tasting menu changes daily to reflect products in season and the duration of the tasting is approximately two hours.

Notes: Formal attire is required (jacket for men and equivalent for women.

The restaurant doesn't allow pictures, but I may ask for a group shot with the chef.

Don't be late. The meal starts promptly at 6:45 and latecomers will miss some of the food.


Allergies: If you have allergies to fish/shell fish I don't think the restaurant can accommodate that (it's a big part of the meal). You are free to double check this if you really want to come.
results.name: Chef's Table at Brooklyn Fare - 3 Michelin Stars

results.description:
VALENTINE'S DAY LOVE WORKSHOP w/ 13 HANDS

The wonderful and annoying mystery of the Heart Chakra - Anahata
THURSDAY, FEB. 11th
7 pm
WELCOME OHM WELLNESS CENTER
1146 Raritan Rd
Clark, NJ

What is love really? Soul mates? Twin Flames? How do we hold another's heart with respect, acceptance and unconditional love? How do we love ourselves more fully? What can we do in these humbling moments when relationships end and/or begin as to embrace and trust that there is a powerful and divine plan for us at work behind the scenes in matters of the heart, in love and on your path? 

Dalien will explore and celebrate the joy, the mystery and annoyance of love...along with exploring the spiritual and physiological relationship of the Thymus gland associated with the Heart Chakra, Anahata. Additionally the heart moves through many phases of emotional growth and healing throughout our lives, very much like the four directions in shamanism. The opening aims to integrate that understanding as we segue into the asanas, pranayama and kriyas that will explore various heart opening sequencing, designed to open the mid and upper back, chest, core and neck as to support proper posture and alignment…. and that creates that calm feeling of expansiveness across your chest. “A lightness in the heart” if you will... 

The experience will be followed by one of the most blissful and relaxing, 45 minute sound meditation/relaxations with the live sounds of Native Flutes, hang drum, quartz crystal bowl, gong and other ambient world instruments. Event ends with some beautiful and celebratory chants for the Heart!!

Benefits of this workshop:
Reduced stress, improved sleep and reduction of anxiety
Increased oxygenation and circulation
Feeling of contentment and happiness
Understanding the importance of parasympathetic nervous system response
The importance of forgiveness, trust and letting go in matters of the heart
Role of thymus gland and immunity
Lots of FUN! :-) 

Join us in the "love attic" as Dalien affectionately calls our space! 

**Spaces are limited and pre-registration is required. To reserve a spot, please paypal $30 to [masked] (select Friends/Family) by February 8th.
results.name: Valentine's Day LOVE Workshop with 13 Hands

results.description:
Join DM Tom Gilbert in his first Wildpig RPG!

A pale body lays among the dark leaves, the blood long since cooled in the late autumn chill. Frost is forming on the ground, coating the corpse in silver. It shines in the dawn light, while the dark red blood freezes on her neck. In the nearby village of Lyalintsi, Magister Illian Antonov is about to discover his daughter is missing. Another young girl from his community is gone, and he must face his people with no more answers than before. The darkness of the forest is closing in on the village, and the night is full of horrors. The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. Maya Antonov is Dead is a campaign for D&D 5E. The focus is on the horror surrounding the players, and the challenge of surviving in a world set against them. Characters will begin at first level, and advancement will be challenging.

Races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling, Tiefling.
Classes: Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Warlock, Wizard
results.name: D&D 5E: Maya Antonov is Dead session 5

results.description:
Right now be honest; most of your problems are just FROZEN. Time to crack the ice around your problems and enjoy the warmth of solutions. "Problems are gifts?" Your deep desires are hidden behind BIG or small problems. We create our future by the problems we ignore or solve today. During this live PLAYSHOP we will tinker and toy with problems to uncover what you really DESIRE. Free your heart and mind for hundreds of NEW POSSIBILITIES.  Running from or suppressing problems blocks you from your future treasure chest. You can have a better future when you start building solutions into your life. Abundance and attracting what you desire happens when you start transforming your problems. The Playshop was created from cognitive science, strategic problem solving and design techniques made simple and FUN! 


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95

How Many Hats Do You Have To Wear moment-to-moment?


Stop and think about your work,business, relationships,dating, finance, and everyday moments.How many hats do your life require you wear and how many hats do you volunteer to wear?Maybe hats of: mother/father,girlfriend/boyfriend, entrepreneur, small business owner, executive, best friend, lover, and more. Hour-to-hour your day changes so rapidly that you have to change hats often and sometimes wear two or more hats at the same time.Each hat brings with it a new set of problems. Start breaking free of problems by building solutions. 


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95


You have already read every self-help book. There is a reason why their message never sticks long-term?  What happened to those New Year's resolutions? results.description:
TOPIC

How many times have you received an instant impression of someone you just met, an intuition about their character? To some extent, we're all doing this all the time unconsciously. There are techniques to help bring this process into consciousness. You may be surprised to discover how much of your chart is "written" on your face in objectively measurable ways.

After the presentation on theory, we'll immediately begin putting it into practice on each other! If you're willing to reveal yourself in front of an audience, we'll very quickly read your face and compare it to your birth chart (accurate birth info is helpful). We will read faces in the order that you sign up, and you may come early.

Please note the modified schedule. We're skipping the usual introductions and beginning the presentation at 7pm SHARP. If you come late, you can still add your name to the list for a reading.


SPEAKER

Kirk Kahn first fell in love with astrology at the age of 16 and has been devoted to unraveling its mysteries ever since. He studied astrology academically at Kepler College and is a regular speaker for NCGR. Planetwatcher.com is among his creations. He is working on a theory of astrology based on deductive logic in addition to feeling the archetypes through the base level of the body, seeking to balance logic with intuition.


A suggested donation is $5 very much appreciated. Please know whatever you can afford is acceptable. Donations collected pay our rent, Meetup.com fees, beverages and snacks, and speaker! If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. Please know they close at 7 pm. 

DIRECTIONS

Our meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. We start at 7 pm.

7:00–8:00 - Main presentation

8:00 - Readings followed by socializing

results.description:
The February Comic Club poll winner was Tomboy:  A Graphic Memoir by Liz Prince!

Bio: Growing up, Liz Prince wasn't a girly girl, dressing in pink tutus or playing Pretty Pretty princess like the other girls in her neighborhood. But she wasn't exactly one of the guys either, as she quickly learned when her Little League baseball coach exiled her to the outfield instead of letting her take the pitcher's mound. Liz was somewhere in the middle, and Tomboy is the story of her struggle to find the place where she belonged.

Tomboy is a graphic novel about refusing gender boundaries, yet unwittingly embracing gender stereotypes at the same time, and realizing later in life that you can be just as much of a girl in jeans and a T-shirt as you can in a pink tutu. A memoir told anecdotally, Tomboy follows author and zine artist Liz Prince through her early childhood into adulthood and explores her ever-evolving struggles and wishes regarding what it means to "be a girl."
From staunchly refuting anything she perceived as being "girly" to the point of misogyny, to discovering through the punk community that your identity is whatever you make of it, regardless of your gender, Tomboy is as much humorous and honest as it is at points uncomfortable and heartbreaking.

Purchase:
Amazon
Barnes & Noble

or your local comic store!
results.name: February Comic Club - Tomboy:  A Graphic Memoir by Liz Prince

results.description:
We're **crazy** excited to have Bryan Cantrill, CTO of Joyent, formerly of Sun Microsystems, presenting on Jails: Confining the omnipotent root. by Poul-Henning Kamp and Robert Watson and Solaris Zones: Operating System Support for Consolidating Commercial Workloads by Dan Price and Andy Tucker!


You can also catch Bryan presenting at the NYC Container Summit on February 10th, which also is hosting an advanced technical track, which includes hand-on tutorials! Also, watch this amazing illumos presentation by Bryan in 2011! 


Abstracts

Jails: Confining the omnipotent root.


===========================

The traditional UNIX security model is simple but inexpressive. Adding fine-grained access control improves the expressiveness, but often dramatically increases both the cost of system management and implementation complexity. In environments with a more complex management model, with delegation of some management functions to parties under varying degrees of trust, the base UNIX model and most natural extensions are inappropriate at best. Where multiple mutually untrusting parties are introduced, ‘‘inappropriate’’ rapidly transitions to‘‘nightmarish’’, especially with regards to data integrity and privacy protection. The FreeBSD ‘‘Jail’’ facility provides the ability to partition the operating system environment, while maintaining the simplicity of the UNIX‘‘root’’ model. In Jail, users with privilege find that the scope of their requests is limited to the jail, allowing system administrators to delegate management capabilities for each virtual machine environment. Creating virtual machines in this manner has many potential uses; the most popular thus far has been for providing virtual machine services in Internet Service Provider environments.


Solaris Zones: Operating System Support for Consolidating Commercial Workloads


===========================================

Server consolidation, which allows multiple workloads to run on the same system, has become increasingly important as a way to improve the utilization of computing resources and reduce costs. Consolidation is common in mainframe environments, where technology to support running multiple workloads and even multiple operating systems on the same hardware has been evolving since the late 1960’s. This technology is now becoming an important differentiator in the UNIX and Linux server market as well, both at the low end (virtual web hosting) and high end(traditional data center server consolidation).This paper introduces Solaris Zones (zones), a fully realized solution for server consolidation projects in a commercial UNIX operating system. By creating virtualized application execution environments within a single instance of the operating system, the facility strikes a unique balance between competing requirements. On the one hand, a system with multiple workloads needs to run those workloads in isolation, to ensure that applications can neither observe data from other applications nor affect their operation. It must also prevent applications from over-consuming system resources. On the other hand, the system as a whole has to be flexible, manageable, and observable, in order to reduce administrative costs and increase efficiency. By focusing on the support of multiple application environments rather than multiple operating system instances, zones meets isolation requirements without sacrificing manageability.


Bio

</a><a href="http://tomasp.net">

Bryan Cantrill is the CTO at Joyent, where he oversees worldwide development of the SmartOS and SmartDataCenter platforms, and the Node.js platform. Prior to joining Joyent, Bryan served as a Distinguished Engineer at Sun Microsystems, where he spent over a decade working on system software, from the guts of the kernel to client-code on the browser. In particular, he co-designed and implemented DTrace, a facility for dynamic instrumentation of production systems that won the Wall Street Journal's top Technology Innovation Award in 2006 and the USENIX Software Tools User Group Award in 2008. Bryan also co-founded the Fishworks group at Sun, where he designed and implemented the DTrace-based analytics facility for the Sun Storage 7000 series of appliances.


Bryan received the ScB magna cum laude with honors in Computer Science from Brown University.


------------------------------------------------------------------------

TwoSigma - Platinum Sponsor of the New York chapter

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Details

Doors open at 7 pm; the presentation will begin at 7:30 pm; and, yes, there will be refreshments of all kinds and pizza. 

After Bryan presents the paper, we will open up the floor to discussion and questions.  

We hope that you'll read the paper before the meetup, but don't stress if you can't. If you have any questions, thoughts, or related information, please visit #pwlnyc on slack, our GitHub repository, where you can also find the papers, or add to the discussion on this event's thread.

Additionally, if you have any papers you want to add to the repository above (papers that you love!), please send us a pull request. Also, if you have any ideas/questions about this meetup or the Papers-We-Love org, just open up an issue.

February's meetup is sponsored by

* Visit our NYC Dads Group website for more events, news and tales from the dad side! * 


Our friends at A Better Balance are hosting this private screening. Tickets are free, but you must RSVP here. 

Equal Means Equal is an unflinching look at how women are treated in the United States today. By following both real-life stories and precedent-setting legal cases, director Kamala Lopez discovers how outdated and discriminatory attitudes inform and influence seemingly disparate issues from workplace matters to domestic violence, rape and sexual assault to the foster care system, the healthcare system to the legal system. Along the way, she reveals the inadequacy of laws presently in place that claim to protect women, ultimately presenting a compelling and persuasive argument for the urgency of ratifying the Equal Rights Amendment.

Presented by A Better Balance. Screening followed by Q&A with the director.

https://vimeo.com/user21014950/equalmeansequaltrailer

Notes: Since this is an open ticketed screening, we will not meet as a group.

FEATURED RISING STAR DESIGNERS:

Pink Sheep Heiress

Pink Sheep Heiress is an American made, Rock and Roll inspired lifestyle brand. It reflects the aesthetic and energy of Katie McKenna, creative director and designer, who founded the brand in 2013 with her brother, Willy McKenna. They formed Pink Sheep Heiress as a celebration of the musician’s life and for others who embrace the rocker style.  Known for its colorful, leather designs and graphic prints, Pink Sheep Heiress creates affordable luxury items and artisan-crafted ready-to-wear for the woman who is her own iconoclastic tastemaker. 

Saint x Sinner - Indonesia 

A collective of cool, edgy and effortlessly sophisticated wear inspired by the streets of New York. Made in Bali, Indonesia - also known as the Island of Gods, Saint x Sinner, was created in 2013 by Astrid Soedjono-Astbury. Saint x Sinner is a reflection of Astrid's fashion-filled life. From her childhood in Jakarta, Indonesia - college life in Australia and her current island life in Bali, the Saint x Sinner collections shares a personal life journey through its one of a kind patterns and eclectic cuts/design

Nippy Lavern

Charismatic, fierce, talented and of course “Fashionista” are just a few words most people use to describe Jessica Martin, founder and creator of Nippy Lavern Fashions. As a rising star in New York’s fashion landscape Jessica Martin has participated in over 130 fashion shows and has executed dozens of photo shoots since 2010. Martin has currently made clothing for stars on VH1, various rap and music artists and on the rise to dress more.

FEATURED RISING STAR DESIGNERS:

Pink Sheep Heiress

Pink Sheep Heiress is an American made, Rock and Roll inspired lifestyle brand. It reflects the aesthetic and energy of Katie McKenna, creative director and designer, who founded the brand in 2013 with her brother, Willy McKenna. They formed Pink Sheep Heiress as a celebration of the musician’s life and for others who embrace the rocker style.  Known for its colorful, leather designs and graphic prints, Pink Sheep Heiress creates affordable luxury items and artisan-crafted ready-to-wear for the woman who is her own iconoclastic tastemaker. 

Saint x Sinner - Indonesia 

A collective of cool, edgy and effortlessly sophisticated wear inspired by the streets of New York. Made in Bali, Indonesia - also known as the Island of Gods, Saint x Sinner, was created in 2013 by Astrid Soedjono-Astbury. Saint x Sinner is a reflection of Astrid's fashion-filled life. From her childhood in Jakarta, Indonesia - college life in Australia and her current island life in Bali, the Saint x Sinner collections shares a personal life journey through its one of a kind patterns and eclectic cuts/design

Nippy Lavern

Charismatic, fierce, talented and of course “Fashionista” are just a few words most people use to describe Jessica Martin, founder and creator of Nippy Lavern Fashions. As a rising star in New York’s fashion landscape Jessica Martin has participated in over 130 fashion shows and has executed dozens of photo shoots since 2010. Martin has currently made clothing for stars on VH1, various rap and music artists and on the rise to dress more.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - Union Square

This course is a companion to the "Intro to Arduino".  In this 2-hour session you will  go from programming simple operations to operations of moderate complexity.  No prior programming experience is necessary.  Students with extensive programming experience in other languages may be given special projects to work on and demonstrate to the class at the end of the session

Reviews from our previous courses:

• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We will provide laptops and Arduinos for participants.

About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

results.description:
Feb 11 Session: Getting Started with Desktop 3D Printers

You asked for it, so we're gonna deliver -- a whole night focused on getting from design to print part. Not a lecture! We have a string of Ultimaker 2 machines, and an elderly MakerBot Replicator 1. Those of us who have clocked hundreds of hours on these will help those just getting started -- as well as those just eager to spend some more time on an unfamiliar machine! 

Those working on the kit building projects for the Kossel and the Ultimaker Original will also setting up in the room as well -- jump in to learn more about the inner workings of desktop 3D printers. 

Tomorrow’s meet up will be a little different from the past few weeks. First of all, you all have an assignment. For tomorrow, using any software application you’d like, design an object no larger than 1 inch by 1 inch by 1 inch. Anything goes except a solid cube. How much detail will you add? Will you have any moving parts? When we arrive, we’ll slice our models, and use the 3D printers at Fat Cat to print them out. Do you want to experiment with different nozzles, test the tolerances of these machines, impress your friends? Here’s your chance.



So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Wednesday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.

results.description:
Right now be honest; most of your problems are just FROZEN. Time to crack the ice around your problems and enjoy the warmth of solutions. "Problems are gifts?" Your deep desires are hidden behind BIG or small problems. We create our future by the problems we ignore or solve today. During this live PLAYSHOP we will tinker and toy with problems to uncover what you really DESIRE. Free your heart and mind for hundreds of NEW POSSIBILITIES.  Running from or suppressing problems blocks you from your future treasure chest. You can have a better future when you start building solutions into your life. Abundance and attracting what you desire happens when you start transforming your problems. The Playshop was created from cognitive science, strategic problem solving and design techniques made simple and FUN! 


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95

How Many Hats Do You Have To Wear moment-to-moment?


Stop and think about your work,business, relationships,dating, finance, and everyday moments.How many hats do your life require you wear and how many hats do you volunteer to wear?Maybe hats of: mother/father,girlfriend/boyfriend, entrepreneur, small business owner, executive, best friend, lover, and more. Hour-to-hour your day changes so rapidly that you have to change hats often and sometimes wear two or more hats at the same time.Each hat brings with it a new set of problems. Start breaking free of problems by building solutions. 


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95


You have already read every self-help book. There is a reason why their message never sticks long-term?  What happened to those New Year's resolutions? The real ANSWER is understanding how your mind MAKES SOLUTIONS and how it blocks out NEW POSSIBILITIES. RSVP for a step-by-steps hands on workshop beyond philosophy and pump up motivation.


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95


 LOCATION


Transform Any Problem into solutions

Thursday February 11  

Time 7:00 pm To 10:00

Location: Ripley-Grier 520 8th Avenue 17 FL 

Between 36th and 37th street 

New York, NY 10018 

Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor

Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end turn right then left to the end of the hall


NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.

Room: 17 M


At Door $25

CLICK TO RSVP ONLINE $19.95

MATERIALS fee included! We use materials because we are always doing active processes based on brain and cognitive dynamics. WE USE STUFF TO MAKE SURE YOU GET RESULTS.


Each group session Rule: "What You Learn Today You Can Use Today"New members at some point start scrabbling to find pen and paper because they show up with an expectation the session is a sale pitch for something else. When "First timers"discover there is a NEW system of knowledge based on new tools, processes and understanding they start asking "do you have a pen and paper I can borrow?" Each session you always learn something you can use walking out the door.

CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
As some of you in the group know, I have practiced shamanic journeying for the past 13 years and I have been doing intensive shamanic training for the past two years. My training has been in what is called core shamanism, practices and healing methods distilled from different shamanic traditions around the world. These methods are used for healing, guidance, and gaining insight, inspiration and creativity for oneself and others in the community.

My offering to our BSFW community is this workshop, in which we will be utilizing shamanic practices to facilitate creativity and to add a new dimension to your writing process.

In this Shamanic Writing Room meeting, we will do exercises and writing prompts based on the practices of guided journeying (guided meditations) to open up access to deeper creativity. To enter a meditative state, I will lead you by my oral instructions and/or a drumbeat.

On your guided journeys, you can meet beings and creatures, both human and non-human, who will inspire you, lead you into other worlds, give you new storylines and ideas, and offer helpful advice. You may see a story unfold or you may personally be involved in the story.

The schedule for the afternoon will be as follows:

7:00pm-7:30pm

To begin our evening, we will introduce ourselves and you will set your own personal goal for the meeting. This could be, for example: I want to write more during the week, I want to break through a block I am experiencing in this story/novel/project. We will set up a special collective place with all of our inspiration objects (see below in list of things to bring with you).

We will enter into a meditative place with some stretching and deep breathing.

7:30pm-8:30pm:

I will lead you through two guided meditations. You will write down your experiences and then will be able to share, if you’d like (you don’t have to).

The 2 guided meditations (journeys) will be:

1 - meeting with the source of your creativity


2 - merging with an element (fire, water, earth, or air)


The meditations (journeys) will be done with my guidance and instruction in a safe and supportive environment. There will be absolutely no drugs (except coffee!).

From 8:30pm-9:30pm, we will all write together, just as in the traditional Writing Room.

Please note: This meeting is limited to seven people.

Please bring, if you have these:

eye covering (a scarf works well)

blanket

notebook & pens

coloring materials

an object, poem, quote, excerpt that inspires you (inspiration objects)

Following is some background and information about shamanism:

Shamanism is an ancient spiritual path and practice that has existed for 100,000 years all over the world. What I have studied and what I practice is core shamanism, which distills the integral practices and methods from all traditions.

It is helpful to remember that it doesn’t matter whether you believe in other worlds or use shamanic language in your own belief system. What is conducive to inspiration is your openness and willingness to try something new. Inspiration occurs in different ways and there is usually a mysterious and unknown aspect to it. If you get a great idea, feel expansions and shifts in perspective, are able to write in a way you never have before, that is what is important. You have your own unique faith and define it for yourself. It is important to honor that in yourself and trust yourself as to what you need, even if you may not know or understand all of the details involved.

Please feel free to email me if you have any questions!

results.description:
The February session of NightShul continues...

NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community (nightshul.org for more information and to sign up). You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. Located at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11230.

Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through February 18.

Offerings:
-Stairways to Heaven: The "Ascent" Psalms, an introspective examination of Psalm 126 or "Shir HaMa'alot," taught by Rabbi Matt Carl
-A Sacred Table, an introduction and exploration of how the Table became the center of Jewish ritual practice and community through out its history from the sages to modernity, taught by Rabbi Sara Zacharia
-iRest yoga nidra, a meditative process of self exploration, taught by Karen Lazarus

SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR MORE INFORMATION AND TO SIGN UP. $15 FOR ONE NIGHT, $35 FOR FEBRUARY SESSION, SEE NIGHTSHUL.ORG FOR FULL SEASON PRICING.
results.name: Let's create a community of adult Jewish learners-- second February event

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in a small group just inside the turnstile, or we gather in the track infield near the long jump pit

results.description:
No need to write new words - the "Sound Mind" is still a gathering for exploring  vibrational healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

We will keep learning how to use our breath and voice for psychosomatic actualization, becoming powerful healers in the process. We can heal our life issues, patterns, past wounds, present woes, and overall life-betrayed-me bitterness. 

The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - and CONSCIOUSNESS - starting from who you are at the moment.

The starting point of CHANGE is like that little red circle on a hiking map that says 'you are HERE'. HERE means in your body. CHANGE is a process anchored in the physical reality, where three roads meet - how you think, how you act, and what is your frame of reference, your environment.

Sound Mind gatherings are influenced by "12 Stages of Healing" by Dr. Donald Epstein, DC, "Radical Honesty" by Dr. Brad Blanton, PhD, and the 12 Steps path of addiction recovery.

Karuna will be hosting the meetings - coming from personal experience as well as her practice and training with the above mentioned methods for healing and recovery.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a change?
results.name: Sound Mind - Community for Change and Growth

results.description:
Final of four consecutive Thursday evenings, January 21 – February 11

with Scott Craven, Hudson Valley historian

Hudson Valley historian Scott Craven tells the fascinating story of how the confluence of unusual people and the Hudson River-itself a geographical oddity-led to shaping the United States as we know them and making New York the Empire State. Includes a fast forward film of the River from 1917!

Scott Craven speaks extensively about a variety of Hudson River topics and teaches local history to teachers at the Ossining Teachers Center. He is a thirty-year member of the Ossining Police Department.

RiverTalks 2016 opens with Hudson RiverLighthouses, a presentation by local historian Scott Craven, on Thursday, January 21, 2016 at 7:00 pm at the Sarah Lawrence College Center for the Urban River at Beczak (SLC CURB). Free Off-street parking. Suggested donation $5. centerfortheurbanriver.org RiverTalks brings together inquisitive minds and a widerange of experts for informal presentations about a variety of Hudson Rivertopics. The program is co-sponsored by SLC CURB and the Yonkers Paddling & Rowing Club (YPRC). RiverTalks Winter 2016 series is curated by Lee Reiser, anavid kayaker, board member of YPRC, and Atlantic division director of recreation and promotion for the American Canoe Association.


This series, entering its sixth year, is held at SLC CURB, an environmental education, research, and community center on the banks of theHudson River just north of the Yonkers Pier.
results.name: Past, Present and Future Importance of the Hudson River

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Members program in a variety of platforms including LAMP, Java, .Net and mobile. We code, in various languages and development environments; some work in CMS and database management

Panera Bread has decent free Wifi, so bring your laptop!

February 11, 2016 · 7:30 PM-9:00 PM
BRIC TV Studio
FREE

Join BRIC TV for an exclusive, live in-studio performance and interview with Renee Neufville.

Renee’s music knows no boundaries and her resume boasts Top 5 hit records as one half of the iconic group ZHANE and world tours as keyboardist/ vocalist in Roy Hargrove’s funky jazz unit, RH FACTOR. A champion of all forms of LIVE music, Renee’s new work is infused with her experiences in the r&b, pop, jazz and Dance hall worlds (lest we forget this Brooklynite’s heart and soul has never strayed far from her native Jamaica). BUT those categories are for the rest of us – for Renee Neufville it’s simply about MUSIC - the songs she writes, the melodies she plays, the bands she leads and the lyrics her exceptional voice caresses. B-Side, BRIC TV's live in-studio music series, features performances from emerging and established musicians on Thursday evenings. These performances are open to the public, however our studio space is limited.


IMPORTANT NOTE

Doors open at 7:30PM. Guests who would like to be part of this intimate, in-studio experience are encouraged to arrive early. Show starts around 7:50PM and it's first come, first served.

Can't make it to the show? B-Side airs live Thursdays at 8pm on BRIC TV. STREAM LIVE! 

RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/b-side-renee-neufville-tickets-20041822631

results.description:
A film of Seven Summits

A documentary presented by Sender Films and Big UP Productions of the first ascent of the Fitz Traverse that includes footage shot by the first ascensionists Tommy Caldwell and Alex Honnold, 3-D graphics and aerial footage tracking the team’s progress across the seven major summits.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZOScetWwEwc#action=share

We live in an age when most of the world's biggest mountains have been climbed. So climbers today get creative and find new ways to push themselves. Some of us get lucky and encounter a moment when technology and skill collide. The right weather materializes, the right partners. The vision for a route emerges, along with the belief that it can be climbed.



The idea to traverse the Cerro Fitz Roy skyline — one of the most dramatic in the world — was not a new one. A much-discussed objective since the '90s, Colin Haley called it the "low-hanging fruit" of Patagonian climbing. Seven glorious summits and a ridge line so dramatic, Yvon Chouinard used it as part of his company's logo.
results.how_to_find_us: Get there early and grab a seat.  This place is tiny!

Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will be peer-led and include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

We start at 8:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture
All proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If PS2G cancels a game, please go to this link ps2g.org/games/refund-request for a refund.

There is a minimum of 4v4 with 8 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

results.description:
**Just in time for Valentine’s Day!**

Hi, my name is Chris. For the last 3 years, I have been learning a whole new approach to relationships. It’s changed everything for me. I’m doing work I’m passionate about, I have an amazing partner, and my sex life has done a complete 180.

So what’s at the core of this new approach? In one word: Orgasm.

Are you still with me?

Good, because it's not what you’re probably thinking! I’m not simply talking about a climax in the bedroom (although that can be part of it). It’s more about approaching life with the same sense of desire, sensitivity, and surrender that we often keep locked away for all but the most intimate of situations out of fear that it is inappropriate.

Well, guess what? I’m here to tell you that it is not! In fact, in this new way of relating, it is the MOST appropriate thing you could possibly do.

You see, as human beings, we are wired for connection. It’s a natural part of our DNA. And while in some ways we live in a very connected world (Facebook, smartphones, etc.), it can feel so hard these days to get the deep intimate connection with another human being that we really desire.

What would your life and relationships look like if you lived this fully out? Come find out as I tell you my story of the transformations I have undergone since deciding it was time for an upgrade, and how I’ve tapped into this Orgasmic approach to life through the practice of Orgasmic Meditation (OM). It’s sure to be a night of sensational discussion!

Event is free to attend. For more questions, contact Chris at (415)[masked]
results.name: Upgrade Your Relationships with a New Operating System

**Just in time for Valentine’s Day!**

Hi, my name is Chris. For the last 3 years, I have been learning a whole new approach to relationships. It’s changed everything for me. I’m doing work I’m passionate about, I have an amazing partner, and my sex life has done a complete 180.

So what’s at the core of this new approach? In one word: Orgasm.

Are you still with me?

Good, because it's not what you’re probably thinking! I’m not simply talking about a climax in the bedroom (although that can be part of it). It’s more about approaching life with the same sense of desire, sensitivity, and surrender that we often keep locked away for all but the most intimate of situations out of fear that it is inappropriate.

Well, guess what? I’m here to tell you that it is not! In fact, in this new way of relating, it is the MOST appropriate thing you could possibly do.

You see, as human beings, we are wired for connection. It’s a natural part of our DNA. And while in some ways we live in a very connected world (Facebook, smartphones, etc.), it can feel so hard these days to get the deep intimate connection with another human being that we really desire.

What would your life and relationships look like if you lived this fully out? Come find out as I tell you my story of the transformations I have undergone since deciding it was time for an upgrade, and how I’ve tapped into this Orgasmic approach to life through the practice of Orgasmic Meditation (OM). It’s sure to be a night of sensational discussion!

Event is free to attend. For more questions, contact Chris (415)[masked]
results.name: Upgrade Your Relationships with a New Operating System

results.description:
https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com

EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month!

InspiredWordNYC (creator/producer of the Queens Lit Fest) Presents We Heart NYC Writers Night + Open Mic at The Parkside Lounge, one of the coolest performance spots in Manhattan's East Village.

This is a celebration of emerging and established New York City writers of all types - poets, novelists, journalists, short story writers. Shows feature carefully selected writers of note, especially those who have recently released books as well as a 12-slot open mic (6-minute time limit, for writers of all types and spoken word poets).

Signed books will be available for purchase - a great chance to show local literary love.

Please share this event on social networks with the hashtags #SupportLocalWritersNYC #BuyBooksNYC #BuyLiteraryPubsNYC #SupportEmergingWritersNYC. It's good karma.

A percentage of the proceeds - and 100% of the #SupportLocalWritersNYC DONATIONS - go to the featured writers.

***21+ age limit (please make sure to bring valid ID)***

*****


When: EVERY 2nd Thursday of the month

Where: The Parkside Lounge
317 East Houston Street (between Stanton and Clinton Streets)
Manhattan, NY 10002

By subway, take the F to 2nd Avenue, walk up the 1st Avenue stairway, then walk east.

Doors open @ 7:45pm. Buy a guaranteed open mic slot via this page. 

*****

Cover Charge: $6 online for non-open mic'ers @  https://weheartnycwritersopenmic.eventbrite.com, $8 online to guarantee an open mic slot, $7 at the door.

***2 Drink Minimum (but drinks are super cheap and $2 non-alcoholic options are available)***

EARLY BIRD SPECIAL - Buy your ticket at least a week in advance and get in for only $5 and bring one audience friend for FREE. LIMITED QUANTITY AVAILABLE.

*****

Make sure to bring a printed out version of your ticket/tickets or be prepared to show your ticket/tickets (with confirmation number) on your phone. Also, bring a valid ID, as this is a strict 21+ venue.

Please Note: No TRANSFERS or REFUNDS will be granted, though you are welcome to find REPLACEMENTS for your tickets.

<a href="http://inspiredwordnyc.com/"></a>

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

Jazz Lovers:

The Greenwich House Music School is hosting an all-star tribute to the late, great pianist Paul Bley this thursday.  Among the luminaries to perform are Ethan Iverson, Frank Kimbrough, and Aaron Parks; there are many more listed at the GHMS website:

http://www.greenwichhouse.org/announcements/free-sound-it-out-mr-joy-a-celebration-of-paul-bey

I have never been to the venerable GHMS but they have several interesting concerts coming up in the next few months, so I am very keen to see what the atmosphere is like; this could become one of our new regular stops in our floating and rotating music festival.  

 And if you are not already aware, this concert is FREEEEEEEE!

Chris

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)
