results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
Watch the Debate #5 with us!


Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is preparing to create theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. There might be multiple Hillarys, a female Bernie, a Greek chorus of "questions from Facebook"--anything to illustrate and illuminate the candidates.

This Debate is hosted by PBS and starts at 9pm but arrive early! And tip your bartender!!

Learn more about the theater project: http://www.theaterinasylum.com/debates.html
results.name: Fifth Democratic Primary Debate Watch Party

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The Town Hall conference call is the second Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Luis Chiang, National Advisory Board Member and Director of the Prayer Team, will lead us in prayer to close the call. Guest speakers will be present at some of the calls to provide input on political issues.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our Town Hall conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

"If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land." (2 Chronicles 7:14 KJV)
results.name: CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA TOWN HALL PUBLIC CONFERENCE CALL

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:15AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
Quebec City Weekend - Fri Feb 12th, 2016 - Mon Feb 15th, 2016 (President's Day)

HOUSE RENTAL - 15mins outside of Quebec City - Approx cost should be about $40 per person for the whole 3 night weekend depending on how many persons we have for the weekend!   We will have space for 14+ persons staying at the large house.   The large house has 3 Bed Rooms and all areas available to us.  Each bed room has 2 queens/full sized beds and there are futons/sofas through out.  Priority for futons/sofas will be given to the first 14 or so persons who have RSVPed YES to this event.  LATER ATTENDEES MAY HAVE TO SLEEP ON SLEEPING BAGS OR FLOOR.  Please bring sleeping bags or air mattresses if you have.   

CARPOOLS & COST - TBD.  8.5 hour drive to Quebec City.  1,300+ approx miles over the weekend.  Approx $75 per carpool passenger for the weekend.  Leaving NYC Friday Feb 12th at tentatively 6am (those leaving at different times can be arranged with between drivers/passengers) and returning to NYC Monday Feb 15th night.

WEEKEND FOOD & DRINK COSTS - TBD.  I will purchase most of the food, drink, and snack items from BJs and/or local supermarkets for the house.  Totals will be split among group.

***Check your passports before having interest to join!***

***Members will be reviewed by group before being able to join this 4 day weekend event.***

I will request that you promptly send a DEPOSIT payment of $30 for the house rental cost.  Balance for house rental costs to due the weekend of this event once I have final rental cost.

NO REFUNDS will be provided.


Logistics and weekend info spreadsheet...  

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dZH7cLSdVyCLZV7qSlZF3w5N5qhxh7GGLbN4Vl5GkEE/edit?usp=sharing

http://www.quebecregion.com/en/

Current exchange rate...  $1 US = $1.39 CAN  (More value for us to cross the border!)


 Winter Carnival Festival...

http://carnaval.qc.ca/en/about/history/

http://www.quebecregion.com/en/what-to-do/activities-attractions/ideas/quebec-winter-carnival/

Admission - $15

Main entrance to the site - Place Desjardins

In the heart of Old Québec.

Plains of Abraham (Place Desjardins), the main site: slides, snow sculptures, dogsledding, children’s site, etc.

In front of the Parliament (Zone Loto-Québec): ice palace, night show, etc.

Place D’Youville: skating with Bonhomme, flapjack breakfast

The first Parade will be presented on February 7 (Charlesbourg) and the second Parade (Upper Town), on February 14. The Night Parades route plans will be available online in the Night Parades section.

The Carnival will last 17 days. Each weekend will be packed with activities for every possible taste and for the whole family. The first weekend will feature a spectacular opening ceremony. The high points of the second weekend will be the Night Parade in Charlesbourg (Quebec City), the Canoe Race and the International Snow Sculpture Competition. Finally, the third weekend will feature you the Snow Bath, the Night Parade in Upper Town, and the Painting Symposium, on top of all of the activities that are continually happening throughout the Carnival. In short, any of the three weekends will treat you to a wide range of winter’s frosty pleasures.

Information - For all your questions during the Carnival festivities, please visit our cabin Info Carnival, located at Place Desjardins on the Plains of Abraham.  Also, our information officers, students of Mérici College, will be happy to answer your questions. Pay attention to them with their red coats and crazy hats!

Activities...

http://carnaval.qc.ca/activities

Night Parade...

Sat Feb 13 7pm - 9pm Night Parade (upper town)

http://carnaval.qc.ca/activities/19

Skiing/Snowboarding/Showshoeing/Dog Sledding...

Mont Sainte Anne Mountain

http://mont-sainte-anne.com/en/

(Also offers Dog Sledding $155, SKI JÖRING w/ dog $55, ICE CANYONING EXPEDITION $102/$86 based on group of 4, Snowshoeing $17 rentals, Cross-Country Skiing $22 rentals, Ice Skating $7)


Will be a beautiful weekend of sight seeing, a winter wonderland & carnival, winter activities, hitting the slopes, and fun!  And of course if it's Will Fong involved there will be some good eats!


More details to come as I prepare this Quebec weekend!

Cheers!

Will

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we're excited to have Erica Duignan Minnihan from 1000 Angels come and share her journey! (Special thanks to Daren McKelvey ([masked]) at R1 Labs for the intro)


Erica is Managing Partner at 1000 Angels, a private venture investment network for select accredited investors. 1000 Angels enables accredited investors to build a high-growth venture portfolio free of management fees, carried interest or capital commitments. The digital platform is complemented by in-person member events with an exceptional community as well as live-streaming educational content and founder interviews.

Erica has been an active investor and advisor to early stage companies for 10 years, and worked on the public market side in investment banking for 7 years prior to that. Before launching 1000 Angels, Erica was a Managing Director at DreamIt Ventures in NYC. She also has served as Executive Director at both STAR Angel Network and Golden Seeds. Prior to beginning a career in venture, she practiced Investment Banking at Citigroup, Credit Suisse and Cantor.

Erica earned her BA in Business Economics from UCLA and an MBA in Finance with honors from Columbia Business School.  She has also made regular appearances on network television for MSNBC and CNBC on "Your Business" and "Crowd Rules" as a startup business expert.  She lives in Tribeca with her husband and three children, and is an avid attendee of Barry’s Bootcamp.

We'll get a chance to hear more about her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay warm and classy... See you then!

Future Events:
2/19 - Tiffany Yu (Diversability)
2/26 - Frank Barletta (LiveUpTop)
3/04 - Sage Wohns (Agolo)
3/11 - Taku Harada (Peatix)
3/18 - Anthony Frasier (The Phat Startup)
3/25 - Gesche Haas (Dreamers & Doers)
results.name: Founders Friday with Erica Duignan Minnihan (1000 Angels)

Best Regards,
Steve Navazio

We hope that you can join the Team at Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo for our upcoming Winter, 2016 Crafting Weekend Get-Away Event ...

Date: Friday, February 12th starting at 10:00 AM through Sunday, February 14th until 3:00 PM
Place: Homewood Suites by Hilton located at 125 State Route 17 (South) in East Rutherford, NJ

We will have prizes; vendors; electric at every table; a tool station with a Cricut Expression and over 70 cartridges in our Lending Library; the Big Shot Embossing machine with several dies and embossing folders; access to the hotel's indoor pool, Business Center and gym; give-aways; FREE Wi-fi; and some fun surprises!


The Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo Store will be set-up on-site for all of your must-have supplies, as well as additional vendors.

TOTAL WEEKEND CROP ADMISSION IS $279.00 per person. (Extra Cropping Space, Ergonomic Chairs and an Early Bird Package are all available for an additional cost)

The price includes: Your cropping space (3 feet); dinner on Friday night; a light breakfast; lunch; dinner and late night dessert on Saturday and a light breakfast and lunch on Sunday, as well as snacks and beverages all through-out the weekend.

A nonrefundable deposit of $100 is required at the time of registration. Please select store pick up as your delivery method to avoid shipping and handling charges. If the balance is not paid 30 days prior to an event, an additional $25 late charge fee will be applied. There are no refunds for cancellations made within 14 days of the start of an event nor any transfers to a future event.

*** If you decide to stay over at the hotel, please make reservations on your own. *** Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo will have a group rate. Additional information to be posted shortly. ***

More details to follow for those attending.

results.description:
"WebPromo SEO Day – Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo"

To Register for this event you must click on this link

WHEN: February 12, 2016 @3:30 pm - 5:30 pm EUROPE/LONDON

ORGANIZER: WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke 

CO-HOSTS:  Moz - Rand Fishkin 

                     SEMrush - Michael Stricker

                     Similarweb - Boaz Sasson

                      BuzzSumo  - Steve Rayson 


This year we have International institutional SEO giants:  Moz, Similarweb, SEMrush and BuzzSumo and the brilliant speakers: Rand Fishkin, Boaz Sasson, Michael Stricker and Steve Rayson.

In 2015, BuzzSumo became tool of a choice for the majority of marketers. We have done little survey asking respondents to name the 5 SEO tools they regularly use, BuzzSummo was included almost every time. 

Absolutely everyone in our survey picked Similarweb, an extremely popular tool, but very few people know how much different the Free and Paid versions are, and the paid version has plenty of options itself from “cheap” to very expensive. 2016 brings a lot of updates and new options for Similarweb. 

SEMrush has been on the market, seems forever, but the company managed to keep the tool fresh and up to date. It is very popular among our respondents. Michael Stricker, U.S. Director of Marketing for SEMrush, has exclusive new data (prepared for this Conference) regarding how Google is treating the new TLDs (Top Level Domain). Be among the first to see this...

Moz Open Site Explorer is a popular tool. Rand Fishkin seems to be in a league of his own. We will be happy to put your questions to Rand, register to the conference and use reply button of the “Welcome email” to send us your questions.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Why attend this webinar:

1. You can ask Rand Fishkin a question Live!

2. Listen and ask question to Similarweb and SEMrush

3. Listen to Steve "BuzzSumo" Rayson

More information about the speakers:

WebPromo.Expert - Anton Shulke - marketing manager - Twitter @WebPromoExperts

Moz - Rand Fishkin - Wizard of Moz - Twitter @randfish

Some people don't need an introduction...

SEMrush - Michael Stricker - U.S. Marketing Director - Twitter @RadioMS

U.S. Marketing Director at SEMrush: April 2014 – Present. Connecting search marketing competitive research with a community of digital marketing experts in SEO, PPC, Content Marketing, Data Research, E-Commerce, Social Media. Enabling consultants, agencies and brands to discover and control the web's most versatile, innovative suite of data tools to perfect their digital marketing campaigns. Helping to promote new market-matching capabilities via agile marketing.

Similarweb - Boaz Sasson - performance marketing specialist - Twitter @SimilarWeb

Currently working as the performance marketing specialist for SimilarWeb.com and Developer.SimilarWeb.com, scope includes SEO, paid search, GDN, Facebook, as well as work on the actual funnels (optimizing and testing ads, landing pages, messages and offers). Started at SimilarWeb in 2009 as a part-time SEO consultant, when we were still called SimilarGroup. Main focus was on SimilarSites.com. Took the site from 7 thousand unique visitors a day to 10-12 million monthly visitors.

To Register for this event you must click on this link

Mobile ready Recording available,  Slides/PDF available


Added Instructions - How To Register: 

Webinara helps you find webinars for different areas of interest, and notify you when there is a new webinar, within your own areas of interest. 

All webinars provided by Webinara are hosted by companies from around the world using different webinar platforms to provide you the webinar. 

When you click Register for the webinar, you need to be logged in to Webinara to come to registration page. 

If the webinar has 1-click registration, and you are logged in to Webinara, you can click the 1-click registration and you will automatically be registered for the webinar. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar.

If the webinar registration button says Register, you need to be logged into Webinara, and when clicking the Registration button, you will be redirected to the webinar registration page for webinar organizer. Register there to get webinar confirmation email. Check your email for the webinar confirmation email, and click the webinar URL to access the webinar

You can login to Webinara or register to Webinara using your email, or just click Sign in with Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn.

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
HVH PRESENTS:

The Full Presidential Traverse 

... in the dead of winter.

WE WILL HAVE SUPPORT ON THE GROUP TO ASSIST IN THIS EPIC ENDEVOR 

A total of 11 4K footers in ONE DAY

Total weekend miles: 25+ / Elevation gain: 10,000+ feet

Kamil - Time to redeem yourself! 

PayPal to reserve your spot! 

EPIC WEEKEND!

The MOST challenging one-day hike in the East!

PayPal $140pp for the 2 nights in the house. 

... 24.5 miles 10,000+ Foot elevation gain.
... 12-20 hours of pure pain and bliss.

Leaving the area Friday afternoon, arriving Conway, NH area by 10 p.m. ... we'll be staying at a large house I have rented. You can also make arrangements on your own if you don't want to stay at the house. I will be accepting payment to reserve your spot in the house within the next three weeks (no refunds).

You do not need to hike the traverse to join the FUN! There are lot's of hiking and skiing options!

Transportation available from Poughkeepsie train station at 1:30pm Friday ($75 RT)

 no refunds 

THE PRESI ...

This hike has SEVERAL opt-out points and routes. If you think you want to use an out, plan ahead for transportation.

Short, cold days. Windy unbearable nights. This one day hike will test your strength and endurance both physically and mentally.

Winter Presidential Traverse is about as difficult and awesome an adventure as one can find east of the Mississippi. The views from the ridgeline in the crisp winter air are unrivaled (and seemingly endless). However, as difficult as the traverse can be in the summer, winter takes every aspect of the traverse and cranks it to 11. The terrain is more treacherous, the temperatures plummet quickly, the winds hit triple digits on most days, snowfall is measured in feet instead of inches, avalanches are common on the large snowfields and in the ravines, and visibility can disappear in minutes ...

... persons wishing to complete a Presi Traverse in winter must be physically strong, familiar with winter mountaineering and compass orientation techniques, very familiar with the terrain, and have high quality winter gear. A winter traverse can go from beautiful to deadly very quickly.

FULL winter gear needed.  Research your gear needs before you go.

Success on this hike is up to you! Know your gear, route, and ability. This hike will be done at your pace, you may be hiking alone. Find a hiking buddy and agree not to split up.

</a>

<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:NHpresidentials.JPG">

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/94/NHpresidentials.JPG

</a>

<a href="http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/0/0/c/highres_90340972.jpeg">

</a>

<a href="http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/c/e/highres_12122766.jpeg">

</a>

The Presidential Range is perhaps most famous for its tumultuous weather, highlighted by the erratic and often extreme conditions upon Mount Washington. Being both at the intersection of several storm tracks and the center of multiple converging valleys funneling wind from the west, southwest, and south make its weather unpredictable and at times violent. The summit of Mount Washington has been known to see snow and ice in all seasons and is subject to a combination of hurricane force winds and blanketing clouds an average of 110 days a year. The mountain long held the record for the highest wind speed ever recorded at the Earth's surface, clocking 231 miles per hour (372 km/h), forcing summit buildings to be chained down so they won't blow away.

THE FINE PRINT ... PLEASE READ: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas ...

Group Size Limitations: If group size exceeds the maximum allowed by government regulations for this route,  separate groups will be formed; hike starts will be staggered to allow at least a one-mile separation.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the <a href="http://www.hudsonvalleyhikers.com/events/calendar/?op=calendar">HVH ABOUT page.

Anyone want to join me in taking this class? This 2.5 hour safari takes place mostly at Times Square; you will better understand issues related to taking pictures in low light conditions (ie. night photography). You will learn how flash and long exposure works and how to use a combination of both long exposure and flash to create an image. You will also learn how to take great pictures WITHOUT using a flash. Although a DSLR is preferred, you may use any digital camera with manual overrides; you MUST bring a tripod.

results.description:
5:30pm-8:30pm 

Devotional path is a path of service and healing. It's about the experience of offering oneself with love to the One who is Love personified. How does it work to live a life of devotion in union with …Divine Union? How can we tap into the reservoir of unconditional, ecstatic, healing, loving, life-affirming path of Bhakti? Who is Radha? Who is Krishna? These are the mysteries we will dive into and explore, take home and try ourselves. You will hear a personal presentation from those who had tried to practice devotional path (bhakti yoga) in their life. You'll be invited to chant and sing devotional songs in Sanskrit. Some of them you know from kirtans at various yoga studios.

This event will include a presentation with a guest speaker, Laksmi Nrisimha Das (Larry Pugliese), followed by kirtan (singing together), followed by sharing food and drink, ceremonially prepared and offered to Shri Krishna.
results.name: Yoga of Devotion - Bhakti Kirtan and more!...

results.description:
Looking for someone new and exciting to spend Valentine's Day with?

Want to enjoy a glass of wine with that special someone?

Then  join us for a pre-Valentine's Day party @ The Gansevoort Park Ave, one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues!

To make this event special the're opening up the normally private Red Room to us & making it a dance party!

Date: Friday, February, 12th

Time: 6-10PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street)

* Drink Specials *

$8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

More details will be posted soon so stay tuned!

Hope to see you there!

Andy
results.name: Valentine's Dance Party @ Gansevoort Park Rooftop, Free Admission!

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

results.description:
AS OF THURSDAY MORNING WE HAVE SPACE FOR 1 MALE AND 1 FEMALE.  IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO JOIN YOU WILL NEED TO CONTACT DAVE CERVINI DIRECTLY AT [masked] OR CALL[masked]-1098. FIRST COME FIRST SERVED. THERE WILL BE 10 ATTENDING (5 MEN AND 5 WOMEN)  Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating, you won’t be alone!.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked]-2256.

We have put together a great weekend for those who love the winter, fresh air, the mountains, good food, making friends, sitting by the fire at night and other winter activities.  Whether you are a skier, snow boarder, cross country/ snow shoe person or just want to learn, this is the weekend for you!  We have once again rented The Beecher House, an amazing vacation home just 5 minutes away from Mt Snow with awesome views, lot's of room, a great fireplace and a huge outdoor hot tub!  This will be an intimate weekend with just 10 attendees who are looking for a fun and relaxing weekend out of the city.  If you are a skier, boarder or just want to enjoy some of the other activities available in the area this is a great opportunity.

The weekend includes:

-Round trip passenger van transportation from NYC and back

.-Breakfast Sat/Sun/Mon (omelets, eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, etc) 

-Delicious 3 course Gourmet Dinner Saturday and Sunday (salads, Chicken, beef, pasta, fish, veggies, desserts)

-All beverages at house: wine, beer, soda, etc

-Snacks & munchies

-3 nights in a shared room (some have bunk beds)

-All linens

-Clean up fee's

-firewood-transportation to and from activities

Cost $530 

Due to the high cost of credit card fees we ask that you send a check or use a non fee money transfer service to save you the fees.  Please contact the host to organize payment [masked] or call[masked]

 What can I expect?  Check out photo's from 2015 CLICK HERE

Ski/board at your own pace.  We'll have designated times and places to meet at the mountain and at the house. All nights will be spent in front of the fire at the house eating, drinking, talking and watching movies/playing games, etc (Oh yes, and the HOT TUB!) You can also go to the local night clubs via a cab  You can also rent snow shoes, cross country skis or spend the day at the Spa on the mountain.

There will also be time for you to explore all the cute shops in Willmington Vermont which is only a free shuttle ride away!

The group will depart from Columbus Circle at 6pm Friday and will depart from  Mt Snow at 3-4pm Monday.

</a> <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Beecher-Photos1.jpg">

Not included: Lunch, lift passes, rentals & lessons


Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will come alone.  We will pair you with someone compatible.

Is there a single supplement? Sorry not for this trip

What are the people like? mostly 20's-40's, laid back, mix or male female, maybe a couple or two & singles.

What about the weather? We go rain or shine as we have a contract for the house.  If it is poor weather we will find other activities to do.

You mentioned bunk beds?  Yes, 2 of the rooms have bunk beds, rooms are chosen by a lottery.  There is one room with a queen bed that is for a couple or friends who would share a bed.

Non refundable for any reason.

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other singles groups. Don't go by the # of RSVP's you see listed. Based on the presales, we will have at least 200 singles attending!

So it's Valentine's Day Weekend and you're single. Rather than spend it staying in, why not go out on one of the biggest hook-up nights of the year and potentially line yourself up a date?  

V-day weekend is actually the best time to go out because you're almost guaranteed the "singles" you're meeting are legitimately single!

This event SELLS OUT every year so get your ticket ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

Prepay Only Event. Price will go up as event gets closer. 

What to expect: 

• Complimentary Appetizers

• Drink Specials 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes

• Top 40 & Hip Hop Music

•  300+ Ready to Mingle Singles 

50% off limited tickets available for $20 ($40 otherwise) 

*MUST PREPAY AT THIS LINK (NO tix sold at the door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

*Since animals need love too we'll also be donating a portion of event proceeds to our furry friends at Bideawee (non-profit organization that helps care for cats & dogs in search of homes) 

FAQs: 

Is this event private? Yes. It will be 100% private for our members and their guests. This is not ethnic/age specific (21+). All are welcome. 

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you'll have a great time. 

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, hats. Jeans ok. 

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets WON'T be sold at door and RSVPing without payment will NOT reserve your spot. To guarantee admission, you MUST purchase your tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for Meetup members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided at the door

So it's Valentine's Day Weekend and you're single. Rather than spend it staying in, why not go out on one of the biggest hook-up nights of the year and potentially line yourself up a date?  

V-Day weekend is actually the best time to go out because you're almost guaranteed the "singles" you're meeting are legitimately single!

This event SELLS OUT every year so get your ticket ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

Prepay Only Event. Price will go up as event gets closer. 

What to expect:


• Complimentary Appetizers

• Drink Specials 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes

• Top 40 & Hip Hop Music

•  300+ Ready to Mingle Singles 

50% off limited tickets available for $20 ($40 otherwise) 

*MUST PREPAY AT THIS LINK (NO tix sold at the door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

*Since animals need love too we'll also be donating a portion of event proceeds to our furry friends at Bideawee (non-profit organization that helps care for cats & dogs in search of homes)


FAQs: 

Is this event private? Yes. It will be 100% private for our members and their guests. This is not ethnic/age specific (21+). All are welcome. 

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you'll have a great time. 

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, hats. Jeans ok. 

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets WON'T be sold at door and RSVPing without payment will NOT reserve your spot. To guarantee admission, you MUST purchase your tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for Meetup members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided at the door
results.name: Pre-Valentine'­s Penthouse Singles Mixer (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Looking for someone new and exciting to spend Valentine's Day with?

Want to enjoy a glass of wine with that special someone?

Then  join us for a pre-Valentine's Day party @ The Gansevoort Park Ave, one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues!

To make this event special the're opening up the normally private Red Room to us & making it a dance party!

Date: Friday, February, 12th

Time: 6-10PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street)

* Drink Specials *

$8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

More details will be posted soon so stay tuned!

For further info [masked]

You can also call/text me at:[masked]

Hope to see you there!

Andy

Plot Summary:

The original 2001 film about a dimwitted male super-model turned wannabe spy earned $60.8 million worldwide. The beginning of the movie is set 10 years later, and Derek & Hansel are literally forgotten. Nobody even knows who they are, so they have to re-invent themselves. Stiller said that Will Ferrell's Mugatu would be back, if the actor is up for it. "If Will says yes, he definitely has to be a part of it. To me, Mugatu is one of the classic screen villains of all time."
results.name: Recline, it's "ZOOLANDER 2" time - Movie & Drinks

Get Tickets At: http://clickmixers.com/valentines-nyc.html

The Next 7 People From This Group That Sign Up Using Discount Code "VALENTINESMEETUP" At Checkout Will Get $5 Off Their Ticket!*

* THIS IS NOT AN INDIAN SPECIFIC EVENT.


* NO TICKETS WILL BE SOLD AT THE EVENT DOOR. YOU MUST PREPAY ONLINE.

THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS A VERY SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING!

Animals need love too! Every Anti-Valentine's Day Party, we donate 50% of all Valentine's Day event proceeds to our furry friends at Bideawee (non-profit organization that helps care for cats & dogs in search of "forever homes.")
  So you're single. Rather than spending "Singles Awareness Day" aka S.A.D. staying in & watching a Lifetime movie of the week, why not go out what is the biggest hook-up night of the year in NYC & potentially line yourself up a date?

Think about it, if someone is out on Valentine's Day, they're more likely than not, legitimately single!  

What to expect:
* 400+ ready to mingle singles
* Complimentary appetizers
* Drink specials from 6-7pm
* Great music all-night
* 50% of event proceeds to benefit our furry friends at Bideawee
* Ice-breakers & prizes

Get Tickets At: http://clickmixers.com/valentines-nyc.html
The Next 7 People From This Group That Sign Up Using Discount Code "VALENTINESMEETUP" At Checkout Will Get $5 Off Their Ticket!

results.name: Pre-Valentine'­­s Day Singles Mixer (Comp Apps, Drink Specials & More)Prepay Onl

results.description:
Looking to meet someone new and exciting to spend Valentine's Day with?

Or want to enjoy a glass of wine with someone special?

Then  join us for a pre-Valentine's Day party @ The Gansevoort Park Ave, one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues!

To make this event special the're opening up the normally private Red Room to us & making it a dance party!

Date: Friday, February, 12th

Time: 6-10PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street)

* Drink Specials *

$8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

More details will be posted soon so stay tuned!

For further info [masked]

You can also call/text me at:[masked]

Hope to see you there!

Andy

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other singles groups. Don't go by the # of RSVP's you see listed. Based on the presales, we will have at least 200 singles attending!

So it's Valentine's Day Weekend and you're single. Rather than spend it staying in, why not go out on one of the biggest hook-up nights of the year and potentially line yourself up a date?  

V-day weekend is actually the best time to go out because you're almost guaranteed the "singles" you're meeting are legitimately single!

This event SELLS OUT every year so get your ticket ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

Prepay Only Event. Price will go up as event gets closer. 

What to expect: 

• Complimentary Appetizers

• Drink Specials 

• Ice Breakers & Prizes

• Top 40 & Hip Hop Music

•  300+ Ready to Mingle Singles 

50% off limited tickets available for $20 ($40 otherwise) 

*MUST PREPAY AT THIS LINK (NO tix sold at the door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

*Since animals need love too we'll also be donating a portion of event proceeds to our furry friends at Bideawee (non-profit organization that helps care for cats & dogs in search of homes) 

FAQs: 

Is this event private? Yes. It will be 100% private for our members and their guests. This is not ethnic/age specific (21+). All are welcome. 

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you'll have a great time. 

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, hats. Jeans ok. 

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets WON'T be sold at door and RSVPing without payment will NOT reserve your spot. To guarantee admission, you MUST purchase your tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/hudson/dates/Feb-12-2016_at_0600PM

results.name: Anti- Valentine's Day Party - Over 200 prepaid

results.description:
Yes it is the year of the monkey! We'll have some fun tonight sharing our Chinese Zodiac animals according to your birth year.  if you don't know it we'll help you discover your "inner animal".

RSVP's begin Saturday, February 6th at 11:00am . Tour and Asia Society Admission is free.  

We'll meet outside the Apple Store street entrance on 5th Avenue at 6pm and enjoy a guided walk up to the Asia Society on 70th Street and Park Avenue for a special Japanese-themed happy hour and sculpture exhibit. There will be music, an origami demonstration and a pop up food bar. See links below.

http://asiasociety.org/new-york/events/leo-bar-happy-hour-0


http://asiasociety.org/new-york/exhibitions/kamakura-realism-and-spirituality-sculpture-japan


En route we'll enjoy the magnificent residential architecture of the Upper East Side Historic district with its distinctive townhouses, mansions and apartment buildings. This is where the silk stocking district meets the "gold coast," an area of private social and business clubs (including the very first Women's Club)that has attracted numerous celebrities and the rich and famous over the years....from Eleanor and Franklin Roosevelt and Grace Kelly to Joan Rivers, Spike Lee, Woody Allen and many more.


Cheers from your organizer,

Hank

[masked]

group.name: "The New York City Expat Meetup Group"

results.description:
Join us for conversation on the Staten Island Ferry while viewing the Statue of Liberty and the NYC skyline.   We will be joining members of "Manhattan Lectures & Conversations."  http://www.meetup.com/Manhattan-Lectures-Conversations/events/228512463/

--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Purpose: Explore how does one discern who is a "good" person? 

What rules can we apply? 

How are these rules valid or invalid?  What are the limits to these rules?  Does the relationship with the person matter?  How does our values or biases matter?

How does one discern when one is faking it? 

Monty Python's method!  How to tell who is a witch, haha.  :D

https://youtu.be/k3jt5ibfRzw

Suggestions 

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Staten Island Ferry (The ferry ride is free.  Good photo op of Statute Liberty and Lower Manhattan skyline.)

About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator.  Yen is currently about $[masked] US.
results.name: Staten Island Ferry Conversation. "How does one discern who is a 'good' person?"

results.description:
Looking to meet someone new and exciting to spend Valentine's Day with?

Or want to enjoy a glass of wine with someone special?

Then  join us for a pre-Valentine's Day party @ The Gansevoort Park Ave, one of Manhattan's most beautiful rooftop venues!

To make this event special the're opening up the normally private Red Room to us & making it a dance party!

Date: Friday, February, 12th

Time: 6-10PM

Dress: To Impress

Admission: FREE!

Location: Gansevoort Park Ave. Rooftop!

420 Park Ave. South (@ 29th street)

* Drink Specials *

$8 red and white wine!

$6 draft beer!

Discounted vodka cocktails!

Party Earth says:

Fashionable patrons taking in the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building from this twentieth-floor hotspot will understand why Gansevoort Park Avenue Rooftop chose "always on top" as its motto.

Sleek and sexy, the space features floor-to-ceiling windows and plenty of sitting areas with suede sofas and wingbacks to accommodate the fashion-industry notables and upscale preppy partiers who gather to check each other out over bottle service.

Clutches of chic Europeans sipping expensive cocktails add just the right jet-set touch to an already swanky scene, complete with the requisite young professionals in tight t-shirts scoping out the beautiful ladies at the brown granite bar.

On warm nights, patrons flock to the spacious terrace to lounge on blue vinyl chaises by the illuminated pool, which features a mosaic of a vintage bathing beauty and is divided into indoor and outdoor sections, allowing guests to dip their toes in year round.

A narrow wraparound balcony bordering two sides of the venue features leather benches and glass floor panels with a dizzying view, while the private Blue Room one floor down offers a true VIP experience that includes exclusive sets spun by renowned DJs.

Stylish party-seekers looking for a combination of upscale vibe, breathtaking views, and a flirty clientele ready to mingle should definitely put this Park Avenue Rooftop on the top of the must-see list.

More details will be posted soon so stay tuned!

For further info [masked]

You can also call/text me at:[masked]

Hope to see you there!

Andy
results.name: Valentine's Dance Party @ Gansevoort Park Rooftop, Free Admission!

Join us for a conversation on the Staten Island Ferry while viewing the Statue of Liberty and the NYC skyline.  We will be joining members from :Manhattan Lectures & Conversations."  http://www.meetup.com/Manhattan-Lectures-Conversations/events/228512463/?

--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Purpose: Explore how does one discern who is a "good" person? 

What rules can we apply?  How are these rules valid or invalid?  What are the limits to these rules?  How does the relationship with the person matter?  How does our values or biases matter?

How does one discern when one "good" person is faking it? 

The Monty Python's method!  How to tell who is a witch, haha.  :D

https://youtu.be/k3jt5ibfRzw

Suggestions 

A. Listen to understand while suspending judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Staten Island Ferry (The ferry ride is free.  Good photo op of Statute Liberty and Lower Manhattan skyline.)

About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator.  Yen is currently about $[masked] US.

results.description:
More info on the convention: http://ponycon.nyc/

Spreadsheet to Roomshare/Rideshare


Ponycon is a successful and fun convention that is right in the heart of Brooklyn in the biggest city in the country! The glitz and glamour or New York City take on a pony theme on Presidents' Day Weekend with three full days of non-stop fun! 

The cool part about this convention is that it is blowing up in popularity similar to how BronyCon was while it was still in NYC. 

The location is certainly a destination in itself at the Grand Prospect Hall. The legendary place has hosted countless weddings, many TV spots and movie scenes and so much more. To say the least, it is the classiest place that a pony convention has ever set foot on and you wanna be there for the awesome occasion! 

Since its months away and its not exactly an exhaustive trip away from the DC area, this is the perfect convention for quite a few of us to go to and enjoy while also be tourists! The spreadsheets above are for the rideshare and roomshare. It will definitely come in handy.


Hope to see you there! 

"WE'LL MAKE YOUR DREAMS COME TRUE!"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JC6AzmXrNbU
results.name: D.C. Bronies Invade Ponycon 2016 in NYC!

results.description:
OVERVIEW

As technology expands and develops we realize that we can use technology to solve very large problems. In the past few years we have seen huge spikes in issues facing underserved communities. Hence, we have decided to bring together Idea machines, techies, entrepreneurs, and students from all backgrounds to develop easy to use but effective solutions that can help bring forth change.

PROBLEMS

How can we leverage current technology in order to close the diversity gap in tech?

How can we use tech to address the negative effects of gentrification?

How can we counter police brutality and improve police surveillance using tech?

How can we use tech to teach financial awareness in underprivileged communities?

AGENDA

Friday, Feb 12th 6pm-9pm

5:45pm-6:15pm Check in/ Registration

6:15pm-6:30pm Welcome

6:30pm-7pm Key Note Speaker

7pm-7:20pm Explanation of problems

7:20pm-7:40pm Create Teams

7:40pm-8:25pm Delegate with team members

8:30pm Submit team name, team members and Problem team will try to solve

8:30pm-9pm Closing for day 1 and Networking


Saturday, Feb 13th 9am-9pm

9am-9:30am Breakfast and Check in

9:30am - 9:45am Welcome and Introduction to day 2

9:45-10:15am Workshop 1:

Research Like a boss, How to find information directly related to the problem you are trying to solve.

10:15am-12pm Hack Away!

12pm-12:30pm Workshop 2:

Ideate don't hate, Learn how to get all your ideas out then pick the right one to pursue

1pm Lunch

2pm-230pm Workshop 3:

Slides on Deck, Learn how to create a quick and simple mock up to present

4pm-4:30pm Workshop 4:

Pitch Perfect, Learn how to effectively format your pitch so that you get to make a huge impact

6pm Dinner

7:15pm Presentation Submissions due

7:30pm Pitches Begin

8:45pm Winners announced


Prizes

1st Place

Most Innovative/Creative Most Likely to exist

Best Use of Tech


Sponsors

TBD


Partners

TBD


Contact

Email [masked] if you have any questions or concerns

results.description:
A forgotten chapter of modern dance history is revealed by Dublin based director, Deirdre Mulrooney. It is the account of Erina Brady, an Irish-German dancer who shortly before World War II brought German expressionist modern dance (Ausdrucksstanz) to a conservative, neutral Ireland. There, Brady, the daughter of a former Irish priest who was initially mistaken for a Nazi spy, opened a dance school to teach the Mary Wigman technique. Her dramatic story, framed within the context of Ireland's thriving contemporary dance scene, comes to life with scenes reenacted by the brilliant Olwen Fouere, and choreographed by Jessica Kennedy. Q & A with Deirdre Mulrooney.

Tickets may be purchased via: http://www.dancefilms.org/film-items/dance-emergency-damhsa-na-heigeandala/ It is presented in the Irish language (with subtitles)
results.name: *TICKET REQUIRED* FILM SCREENING: DANCE EMERGENCY / DAMHSA NA HEIGEANDALA

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.comand several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because this event is more about socializing and having fun!  It is a great way to spend a Friday evening with dozens of other fun members and friends!

You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, take picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).  At least One person in your group will need to have a camera.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/moma-scavenger-hunt-and-cocktails-tickets-21249105647

Can I come alone?  YES! 95% of those attending will come on their own.  If you come alone we will randomly set you up on a team.

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle tavern for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

Here is how it works:  Arrive at Old Castle Tavern between 6pm-6:30pm, enjoy a cocktail and get set up on a team (if you already don't have one)  Once you have a complete team we will send you out to the museum to find all the clues.

What am I looking for at the museum? All the clues are things that are already at the museum.  It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people that are there! Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible.  The teams with the most points will win prizes.  Don't worry if you didn't answer all the items because there are bonus points.

Level: First timers to "I do this all the time"

Cost $15 general admission

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/moma-scavenger-hunt-and-cocktails-tickets-21249105647

What's included?

- Admission to MOMA

- Private reception with drink Specials at the bar

- A fun way to visit the museum

- A unique way to make friends

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be other people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: MoMA Scavenger Hunt and Cocktails

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间2月12日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
Two couples bound together by marriage, blood, and a marital indiscretion share a beach house on Fire Island for the Fourth of July.   Over the course of the day, they cook, eat, drink, and dance, but mostly they talk — comically, cuttingly, poignantly — to, over, and at one another and themselves, about love, infidelity, fear, disease, death, and musical comedy.

Directed by Susanna Frazer      

Come at 6:30 for the reception, and stay after the play for a discussion of the ethical issues it raises. 

Playreading starts at 7 pm..

These tend to be excellent with an interesting discussion of the ethical issues afterward. Please note: there is a requested donation of $10 (which I think from past experience is more than just optional, so I would plan on paying $10 if you attend) and the reception is normally not a meal....so I highly recommend eating supper before attending.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be greeting folks by the food reception table, I look a lot like my photo! :-)
results.name: Playreading and Ethical Discussion: Lips Together, Teeth Apart Terrance McNally

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: SPANISH CULTURE & CONVERSATION WORKSHOPS (BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATE)

results.description:
Please note:  This is not an ATWYS event.

This is a Charity Singles event benefitting the animals of Bideawee.        
No vouchers will be honored to this event. 

Animals need love too! Every Anti-Valentine's Day Party, we donate 50% of all Valentine's Day event proceeds to our furry friends at Bideawee (non-profit organization that helps care for cats & dogs in search of "forever homes.")

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$20 in advance only - Prepay here: http://antivday2014.eventbrite.com


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


So you're single. Rather than spending "Singles Awareness Day" aka S.A.D. staying in & watching a Lifetime movie of the week, why not go out what is the biggest hook-up night of the year in NYC & potentially line yourself up a date?

Think about it, if someone is out on Valentine's Day, they're more likely than not, legitimately single!  

What to expect:

Complimentary appetizers

Hip-hop and Top-40 all-night

50% of event proceeds to benefit our furry friends at Bideawee

Ice-breakers & prizesProfessional photography

Come show your talent and/or listen to your fellow members at "Show and Play" hosted by IAN and Sonicbids. There will be food and drinks. No cover (Those who are performing can only use their instruments or perform acapella) Please SiGN UP to perform with one of our organizers beforehand. The deadline is Wednesday Feb 10th

You guys are already familiar with IAN (Independent Artist Network), now here's a little info about Sonicbids:

Sonicbids helps musicians get more gigs by giving them access to better search criteria (like preferred genre, paid/unpaid), a streamlined application process, 100% verified gigs, and tools to help them manage their career.  In 2016 we are working on a number of launches around finding & collaborating with other musicians, & making gig applications more effective than ever.  We can’t make you successful, but we can give you a path forward.

If there are any other questions, please contact the organizers.

results.description:
Join us for knitting, weaving, crocheting (etc), good pastries, and great coffee.  This location does not serve beer. If you know of one that does and is near this location let me know and I'll check it out for next month's meeting.

Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by Janna. So, if you're a newbie she will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.

Instruction here is really laid back and not structured like an actual class.  Janna teaches long-tail cast on and basic knitting and purling stitches for beginner projects like fingerless mitts or a garter stitch scarf. She can show you the basics of both tapestry weaving and four-harness weaving on a portable loom that you provide. Here's a DIY video by Janna showing you how to make a PVC tapestry loom for $15 

http://www.vancouveryarn.com/make-a-pvc-tapestry-loom.html

For those of you who would like knitting or weaving instruction be sure bring your own supplies. Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging me (Janna Maria Vallee.)

Kaffe 1668 closes at 10pm

PnP would love to see/support your progress at other meetups throughout the month!
results.how_to_find_us: There are two Kaffe 1668's near each other, make sure you're headed to the right one.  We will be downstairs at the big table.
results.name: Crafting at Kaffe 1668 with free beginner weaving and knitting instruction

venue.name: Tito Puente Education Complex

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

We reserved the lower level at Boxers HK for drinks, bonding, and festivities! Hang out with fellow GAPIMNY members or come meet new friends! 

- 2-for-1 Drinks, 7pm-9pm

As always, feel free to invite and bring friends to this event!

Elixir Happy Hours occur every 2nd and 4th Friday of each month.

Also, sign up for GAPIMNY's mailing list and/or become a member here:

http://www.gapimny.org/membership/
