results.description:
The Potpourri Salon - literary branch of NYC Continental Philosophy Meetup – had great talks this fall: John Ruskin, Anatole France, Jean-Jacques Rousseau. We are beginning the spring season and have room for a few new salonistes. Join us if you are serious about reading and talking about what you read ... but are light-hearted, drink wine and love good laughs. As a loose (VERY loose) selection principle (i.e. for selecting the books we read), we look to Marcel Proust - NOT for reading his masterwork “In Search of Lost time,” but for inspiration from the rich “intertext” within (intertext= other texts alluded to or influencing the top one.) You don't have to be a Proustian to partake of our potpourri - only an appetite for reading with us and for talking about what we read. We are diverse, smart, love one-liners– and have a taste for philosophy (as well as wine and snacks.)

Please contact me personally, Sharon, at [masked] Tell me a little about yourself – e.g. your reading background or what interests you about this announcement or Proust intertext … or anything else concerning reading or discussions about books. We meet in a private residence and try beforehand through email or telephone to ensure a good match.

"There is a great difference between reading a book on one's own or with people who appreciate and pick out the fine passages and so keep one's attention from flagging"  (Mme Sévigné to her daughter, 15 July 1671)

Here's what's in the pantry - upcoming.

Letters of Mme Sévigné (January)
Lost Illusions – Balzac
The Stones of Venice – John Ruskin 
The Story of a Child – Pierre Loti 
Montaigne Essays
Charterhouse of Parma – Stendhal 
Love – Stendhal 
Esther, Phèdre - plays (Racine) 
The Girl With the Golden Eyes - Balzac 
Memoirs of Saint-Simon (selections)
Why the Dreyfus Affair Matters by Louis Begley
Dreyfus Affair from Origins of Totalitarianism by H. Arendt
Mémoires d'Outre-Tombs - Chateaubriand
results.name: Potpourri Salon

group.name: The NYC Continental Philosophy Reading Meetup Group

results.description:
I know that we are a meetup group of beer lovers, but beer aficionado and fashionista Joaquin suggested there might be people other than just him and me who might be interested in going to see the best movie that will be released in 2016....Zoolander 2. I've been waiting for the sequel since the original came out and I'm following Joaquin's fashionably fierce lead and setting up this meetup. Since beer is not necessarily involved, I won't take attendance or anything but if you want to see the movie and hang out, then come on out. Maybe we can go for beers after.

I would recommend buying tickets in advance and showing up early to get seats. I'm going to try to be there by 6:50 for the 7:20 show. I'll save a few seats if I can but movie going is blood sport in NYC and I'm not taking a beating for anyone! Here's the link to buy tickets.

http://www.fandango.com/amcloewslincolnsquare13_aabqi/theaterpage?date=2/12/2016

Wear your most fashionable clothes and see you there.

Cheers,

Bill
results.name: Let's put on our best "Blue Steel" and watch Zoolander 2.

results.description:
BOOK NOW FOR OUR BIGGEST EVENT OF THE YEAR!

Confirm your place at our celebration of Charles Darwin’s 207th birthday — and the 28th Anniversary of the founding of SHSNY — along with 60 or more of your fellow freethinkers at top-rated Byblos in midtown.

The highlight of the evening will be a brand-new performance by our own Richard Milner.

“Darwin, Wallace, and Other Voices in My Head”

After a lifetime of study, he says, Mr. Milner has developed close personal friendships with certain famous dead white men, and will channel their quirks, their humor, and their wisdom. He promises also to demonstrate how Victorian spiritualists produced “ghostly writing”.

Don’t miss it, because it’s going to be fun! We’ll feast on abountiful buffet (lots of veggie choices) ... mingle, mix and make new friends ... vote for the Dumbth of the Year ... and enjoy a fascinating and fun presentation ... all for ...

Just $60 per person, tax/tip included (cash bar).

Prepay (credit card or PayPal) at <a>www.shsny.org.</a> Or mail your check to SHSNY, PO Box 7661, New York, NY 10150-7661.

Questions? Call[masked] (leave a callback number).
results.name: SHSNY 8th Annual Darwin Day/SHSNYAnniversary Celebration

results.description:
The Backwoods Adventurers are headed back to the Catskills, y'all! The aim of the long weekends is to bag requisite winter 3500 peaks (Blackhead & Black Dome ) and possibly SW Hunter land plan on a casual, light hike, skiing and/or brunch @Phoenicia Diner Monday morning.

Hiking Pace: We tend to average ~1.5 miles per hour with breaks when folks collectively need to stop to ensure we're keeping to a pace. Those who have hiked with the Backwoods know we have a 'no one gets left behind' policy, but if you're a fast hiker we ask you take to the buddy policy with someone who goes your own pace;


The Plan: To make the most of the weekend, we'll leave NYC on Friday night @7pm and stay at an Airbnb cottage rental in Hunter, NY.


(Saturday) Blackhead and Black Dome out and back, with jagged and rugged trails, this is a strenuous but top 5 most rewarding hikes;


(Sunday) SW Hunter out and back


(Monday - optional) Hunter Mtn. Skiing &/or brunch in Tannersville Accommodations / Cost: $104.25

We'll rent one or two cabin units within 5-10 miles of the trailhead in Hunter; This includes a spot in two queen, full or single beds or space to unroll a sleeping bag in the living room. The sub total so far is $104.25 for the long weekend. I'll confirm the price per person closer to the date. A $45 deposit is required to reserve a spot in the lodge with us!


To reserve your spot, please remit payment for the deposit to Mike via Venmo (http://www.venmo.com) or Paypal (https://www.paypal.com/). Send $45 deposit to me ([masked]), being sure to check "I'm sending money to family or friends" if using Paypal.


**Please Note that by RSVP-ing to attend this Meetup, you are agreeing to pay the organizer(s) for the cabin reservation within a reasonable time frame prior to the long weekend -- Receipt of the deposit reserves your spot for the weekend accommodations. Your attendance will be revoked and offered to someone else if the deposit is not received by Jan. 10 to be courteous to others who may like to attend.Everyone's work schedule differs. By making the deposit, you signify you will make it to the agreed upon departure spot in Manhattan by 7 p.m., with a ~20 minute window for stragglers who text that they're on the way.

Weather: This is an all weather event. We will monitor the forecast for severe weather and may cancel depending on the severity of the predicted weather.


Gear:


1) Hiking boots & poles (optional), gloves & hat - winter hikes and at times descents of 1,000 ~ 1,500 feet of elevation are not something you want to mess with - it's better to have ankle support than to try to descend a 35-er in trail shoes or sneakers or mid-cut shoes designed for Harriman.


2) Since these are winter ascents, micro-spikes or crampons are required. Ice, rain or snow (or no icea) at 2,000+ feet of elevation it's always best to carry spikes than to not carry them and have to descend 1,000 feet of elevation without them. Catskills ascents are not really geared towards snow-shoeing, plus with the mild past two winters, I'd advise against bringing in the first place.


3) Moisture-wicking layered clothing fit for winter dayhikes, such as fleece, thermal base layer or synthetic wool shirt and outer rainshell or puffy jacket; Obviously you know your body the best, so when you break into a sweat on the 2.5 miles up, it's best to dry off during that short break at the peak and avoid those parts of the day when there could be shadows b/w mountain valleys or cool breezes in general, so layering is key and not staying damp!

4) Hydration: no matter of Camelback or Nalgene bottles or the latest brand on the market at REI, I always say bring up to 2 liters of water for a 6 to 8 mile hike.


**If you're new to hiking, check out our day hiking gear recommendation page.


5) Food / Snacks: We'll have the ability to have coffee & light breakfast at the cabin before we drive to the trailhead; after that I'd recommend bringing trail mix snacks or Cliff bars in general plus fruit or greens / sandwich or whatever you like for a peak lunch! We'll be having dinner out on Saturday / Sunday nights in Phoenicia or Tannersville, depending on a group vote.


6) Camera phone / camera - we prefer not to stop every 15 minutes for photo takers, Instagram or tweeters, but encourage you to bring yr phone / camera for group shots here and there! Cell phone service is poor pretty much everywhere in the Catskills so don't expect to communicate with the outside world much unless there's Wifi at the lodge!!

7) NYNJTC trail maps (Trail Map #143 - Southern Catskills) - optional, but doesn't hurt to buy these maps at REI, EMS, Campmoor, NYNJTC website or elsewhere - Depending on how serious of a 3500 hiker you are! Or download to your smartphone! (last I checked, $7 per segment in So. Catskills vs. No. Catskills thru PDF Maps & NYNJTC download)


Transportation: We will carpool and passengers pick up the tab on gas/tolls. If we do not have enough drivers we will rent a car or van and split the cost. Please post if you need a ride or can give a ride. Drivers please post on your RSVP from where and how many passengers you can take.

(Above: the 2014 Backwoods group on a pre-winter Balsam dayhike)

Group Disclaimer: As with other hikes on this Meetup group, any of these 3 dayhikes may be new trails and ascents for the organizers. We'll be following the NYNJTC trail map, research on the trail (noted above) and our own sense of direction. Marked trails are easy enough to follow but at times, including in the winter, we might deviate down an incorrect path. You'll be expected to be prepared and involved in any decisions made on trail routes, etc. For experienced or fast-paced hikers who intend to join us, please note that you should have your bearings for the trail before departing.

Meetup Disclaimer: You agree when you sign up that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance to an event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. The complete liability waiver can be found on the PAGES section of this meetup site.

(Above: The gals of NYC Backwoods at a 2013 ascent of Westkill!)
results.name: Catskills 3500 Series: Presidents Weekend Cabin Rental (Black Dome)

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.
results.how_to_find_us: www.nyshamaniccircle.org
results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

results.description:
Occasionally one is confronted with ailments that resist conventional therapies. One feels like they’ve been “cursed” (“No matter what I do I can’t shake it off”). Through past life regression or readings, often a deeper reason for the ailment is found. Healing of the past can be achieved through bioenergy, and occasionally with homeopathy. Another aspect discussed is what shamans call soul
retrieval. Bioenergy healing addresses this category in an energetic way. Examples, readings and therapies will be reviewed during class
results.name: KARMIC HEALING & SOUL RETRIEVAL WITH BIOENERGY

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of Lips Together, Teeth Apart by Terrance McNally

Two couples bound together by marriage, blood, and a marital indiscretion share a beach house on Fire Island for the Fourth of July. Over the course of the day, they cook, eat, drink, and dance, but mostly they talk — comically, cuttingly, poignantly — to, over, and at one another and themselves, about love, infidelity, fear, disease, death, and musical comedy.

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description: The February meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society, Inc. will feature a video presentation on “The Eruption of the Krakatau, Volcano, 1883”. Although misspelled in the original telegraph message as Krakatoa, the Krakatau volcanic eruption of August 27 was one of the best documented natural disasters in history. Come watch this eruption happen in this docu-drama video from the perspective of Dutch settlers as they were subjected to a seismic sea wave more than 140-feet tall and a thick rain of pumice and ash killing over 36,000 people in nearby regions after the main volcano was destroyed. This meeting will take place on Friday, February 12, at 7:30 PM in the Father Hicks Center at St. Clare's School, 151 Lindenwood Road, Great Kills, Staten Island, New York [masked]). The meeting is free and open to the public. For further information call:[masked]-5786.

results.description:
From the creators of Quiet Events comes a hilarious show where you get to eavesdrop on a couple’s first date! Not only will you be able to hear what they are saying…but what they are THINKING too! Boy Meets Girl is an interactive play where you get to tune into to the girl or guy’s inner thoughts using special Quiet Events headphones. With one push of the button, you choose whether to stick with one or swap between the two.

David and Katie both swiped right… so they must be perfect for each other, right? Go on their first date and find out. You’ll get a hilarious glimpse into what are guys and girls really thinking when they first meet.

Come early and enjoy dinner and drinks at the bar. You’ll also get to listen into what the actors are thinking about before their big date.

Showtime details:
Location: Hudson Station – 440 9th Ave, NY, NY (Btw, 34 & 35th)
Dates: Jan 29th & Feb 12th
Show begins promptly at 7:30pm-9:30pm

More Details
– Tickets are limited
– Possible sexual & vulgar content
– Price includes 1 FREE ticket to Quiet Clubbing Party ($25 Value)
– Credit required for headphone rental (1 card per group)
– Kitchen & Bar opens at 4pm
– From 4-6pm Show your ticket and get buy 1 get 1 FREE drink

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to the two actors with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows who you are listening to. You’ll be seated at at table, you can order food & drinks to enjoy the show. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones else there will be a $100 charge.

THE PEOPLE WHO MAKE IT AMAZING

david
DAVID CARL (David): Originally from Dallas, TX, David has been working as an actor in New York since 2006. You may have caught him in the Awesome 80s Prom, Point Break LIVE!, Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet, or various productions with Project Y and Slant Theatre. Gary Busey Hamlet received an award for “Overall Excellence in Solo Performance” and an extension at Fringe NYC 2014. In 2015 David and his team took the show to Florida, Colorado and Edinburgh Fringe.

You might have seen him on Guiding Light, All My Children,or heard his voice on the radio, TV or internet hawking fast foods, banks, and gas. He also performs improv every week at the PIT with Skycopter, where he recently co-wrote, and performed David and Katie Get Re-Married with Katie Hartman. David has a BFA from the University of Evansville and an MFA from Rutgers.

Sashe- SASHA EDEN (Katie’s Thoughts): is an Actor and Producer; she is the recipient of The Harlequin More Than Words Award for being a “real life heroine” and was selected by The UTNE Reader as one of the 25 Visionaries Who Are Changing Your World. She graduated from Vassar College. As an Actor, Sasha’s work has been featured on stage, television and film.

Katie- KATIE HARTMAN (Katie): writes and performs as one half of the acclaimed NYC sketch comedy duo Skinny Bitch Jesus Meeting (Edinburgh Fringe, NYC Fringe, Austin Sketchfest, Women in Comedy Festival, Charleston Comedy Festival, etc.). SBJM was recently named “one of the twenty-five funny people that should have their own TV show” by Complex Magazine. She is co-creator/co-star of the web series “Made To Order” (madetoorderseries.com) which was recently was listed as one of “6 Brilliant Web Series” by Marie Claire. Katie can be seen on the popular web series’ “High Maintenance” and with regularity on the Webby-winning YouTube channel “Barely Political.” Last fall she performed in the seasonal off-off Broadway monologue play The Pumpkin Pie Show: Seasick and is a rotating cast member in the Off-Broadway production ofFlanagan’s Wake,an interactive, half-improvised play, Katie improvises weekly with PIT House teams Gypsy Danger and Big Black Car

Robert- CHRIS ROBERTI (David’s Thoughts): is an actor and writer who lives in Brooklyn. He performs weekly at the PIT and is a founder of Bankrukt Productions. chrisroberti.com bankrukt.com

THE CREATIVE TEAM

Marlo- MARLO HUNTER (Director): Director/Choreographer & Callaway Award winner for Unlock’d (The Duke – Prospect). Select as Director/Choreographer: My Life Is A Musical (Lab at The Duke, Bay Street), Date Of A Lifetime (NJ Rep), Island Song (BPP); as Choreographer: LMNOP (TUTS); Lips Together, Teeth Apart (Second Stage). Founder, Eating Their Words: directed new plays by Annie Baker, Neil LaBute, Douglas Carter Beane, Theresa Rebeck, Amy Herzog. Co-Creator, Director: The Theatrical Culinary Project w/Chef Carla Hall. UPCOMING: Director/Choreographer – Island Song(Adirondack Theatre Festival). B.A., Princeton. www.MarloHunter.com

Rainey- RAINEY ROWAN (Producing Assistant): Rainey Rowan has coordinated and produced with companies such as Slant Theater, Frames Lounge, Eating Their Words, and Theatrical Culinary Project. She’s excited to be working again with Marlo Hunter and Sasha Eden on this ‘Quiet’ venture. Rainey is an operations manager at the premier dance studio Steps on Broadway, and continues to dance, sing, and act in her rare moments of free time.

Will- WILL PETZ (Producer & Innovator): Social Party Expert since 2001, Will has hosted unique events throughout NYC and produced hundreds of themed parties including Quiet Clubbing parties with offices in NY, LA, SF, and Austin. Quiet Theater is another visionary event that Will is excited to expand on in 2016
results.name: Boy Meets Girl – “The First Date” (Quiet Theater)

results.description:
BUY TICKET HERE


From the creators of Quiet Events comes a hilarious show where you get to eavesdrop on a couple’s first date! Not only will you be able to hear what they are saying…but what they are THINKING too! Boy Meets Girl is an interactive play where you get to tune into to the girl or guy’s inner thoughts using special Quiet Events headphones. With one push of the button, you choose whether to stick with one or swap between the two.

David and Katie both swiped right… so they must be perfect for each other, right? Go on their first date and find out. You’ll get a hilarious glimpse into what are guys and girls really thinking when they first meet.

Come early and enjoy dinner and drinks at the bar. You’ll also get to listen into what the actors are thinking about before their big date.

Showtime details: 
Location: Hudson Station – 440 9th Ave, NY, NY (Btw, 34 & 35th) 
Dates: Jan 29th & Feb 12th 
Show begins promptly at 7:30pm-9:30pm

More Details 
– Tickets are limited 
– Possible sexual & vulgar content 
– Price includes 1 FREE ticket to Quiet Clubbing Party ($25 Value) 
– Credit required for headphone rental (1 card per group) 
– Kitchen & Bar opens at 4pm 
– From 4-6pm Show your ticket and get 2 for 1 drinks!

HOW IT WORKS 
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to the two actors with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows who you are listening to. You’ll be seated at at table, you can order food & drinks to enjoy the show. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones else there will be a $100 charge.

THE PEOPLE WHO MAKE IT AMAZING

david 
DAVID CARL (David): Originally from Dallas, TX, David has been working as an actor in New York since 2006. You may have caught him in the Awesome 80s Prom, Point Break LIVE!, Gary Busey’s One-Man Hamlet, or various productions with Project Y and Slant Theatre. Gary Busey Hamlet received an award for “Overall Excellence in Solo Performance” and an extension at Fringe NYC 2014. In 2015 David and his team took the show to Florida, Colorado and Edinburgh Fringe.

You might have seen him on Guiding Light, All My Children,or heard his voice on the radio, TV or internet hawking fast foods, banks, and gas. He also performs improv every week at the PIT with Skycopter, where he recently co-wrote, and performed David and Katie Get Re-Married with Katie Hartman. David has a BFA from the University of Evansville and an MFA from Rutgers.

Sashe- SASHA EDEN (Katie’s Thoughts): is an Actor and Producer; she is the recipient of The Harlequin More Than Words Award for being a “real life heroine” and was selected by The UTNE Reader as one of the 25 Visionaries Who Are Changing Your World. She graduated from Vassar College. As an Actor, Sasha’s work has been featured on stage, television and film.

Katie- KATIE HARTMAN (Katie): writes and performs as one half of the acclaimed NYC sketch comedy duo Skinny Bitch Jesus Meeting (Edinburgh Fringe, NYC Fringe, Austin Sketchfest, Women in Comedy Festival, Charleston Comedy Festival, etc.). SBJM was recently named “one of the twenty-five funny people that should have their own TV show” by Complex Magazine. She is co-creator/co-star of the web series “Made To Order” (madetoorderseries.com) which was recently was listed as one of “6 Brilliant Web Series” by Marie Claire. Katie can be seen on the popular web series’ “High Maintenance” and with regularity on the Webby-winning YouTube channel “Barely Political.” Last fall she performed in the seasonal off-off Broadway monologue play The Pumpkin Pie Show: Seasick and is a rotating cast member in the Off-Broadway production ofFlanagan’s Wake,an interactive, half-improvised play, Katie improvises weekly with PIT House teams Gypsy Danger and Big Black Car

Robert- CHRIS ROBERTI (David’s Thoughts): is an actor and writer who lives in Brooklyn. He performs weekly at the PIT and is a founder of Bankrukt Productions. chrisroberti.com bankrukt.com

THE CREATIVE TEAM

Marlo- MARLO HUNTER (Director): Director/Choreographer & Callaway Award winner for Unlock’d (The Duke – Prospect). Select as Director/Choreographer: My Life Is A Musical (Lab at The Duke, Bay Street), Date Of A Lifetime (NJ Rep), Island Song (BPP); as Choreographer: LMNOP (TUTS); Lips Together, Teeth Apart (Second Stage). Founder, Eating Their Words: directed new plays by Annie Baker, Neil LaBute, Douglas Carter Beane, Theresa Rebeck, Amy Herzog. Co-Creator, Director: The Theatrical Culinary Project w/Chef Carla Hall. UPCOMING: Director/Choreographer – Island Song(Adirondack Theatre Festival). B.A., Princeton. www.MarloHunter.com

Rainey- RAINEY ROWAN (Producing Assistant): Rainey Rowan has coordinated and produced with companies such as Slant Theater, Frames Lounge, Eating Their Words, and Theatrical Culinary Project. She’s excited to be working again with Marlo Hunter and Sasha Eden on this ‘Quiet’ venture. Rainey is an operations manager at the premier dance studio Steps on Broadway, and continues to dance, sing, and act in her rare moments of free time.

Will- WILL PETZ (Producer & Innovator): Social Party Expert since 2001, Will has hosted unique events throughout NYC and produced hundreds of themed parties including Quiet Clubbing parties with offices in NY, LA, SF, and Austin. Quiet Theater is another visionary event that Will is excited to expand on in 2016

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This Friday lets do something different.  Lee just moved into a new place in Astoria and wants your company.  We will be meeting at the Beer Garden across the street from his new place and after will be heading to Lee's place. Come on out and join us for an awesome night of Drinking With Atheists and help Lee restock his liquor cabinet.  


Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Penny Jung

results.description:
Lets’ warm up the night together this Valentines Day with The Dancin’ Machine at The West Gate Lounge located in the  Best Western on Rt 59 in Nyack(across from the Mobile station)!  Dancin’ Machine is New Yorks' only 10 piece 70's disco band! Check them out monthly at the Westgate Inn! Put on your dancin’ shoes and come "shake your groove thing"!  Its' a "Meetup Love-in"! Not for singles only.

The DJ starts the party going at 8 and the Disco Tribute band; Dancin 'Machine starts at 9:00. Come early and lets' get the party started! Dress is casual but appropriate attire.  Bell bottoms are welcome!

ADMISSION IS ONLY $10.  Appetizers and a bar menu are available and the hotel restaurant is open til the wee hours for you night owls and anyone who works up a big appetite!

MEET US AT THE 3-4 TABLES BY THE BACK  WALL  ACROSS FROM THE BAND or to the left of the stage.   LOOK FOR THE MEETUP SIGNS OR FIND US ON THE DANCE FLOOR! (Its' a small room so you shouldn';t have trouble finding our tables) 

INCLEMENT WEATHER CANCELS.  ALWAYS check the day of an event for possible changes.

DIRECTIONS:

Conveniently Located for Easy Access Onto All Major Highways

DIRECTIONS
The West Gate Lounge located at the Best Western Nyack on Hudson is accessble via the New York State Thruway (Interstate 87). Traveling West over the Tappan Zee Bridge, take Exit 11, Nyack. At the end of the ramp, the hotel is immediately located on your right. When traveling East Take Exit 11, Nyack. At the traffic light, make a left onto Route 59 East. The hotel/lounge is located on your left immediately after the overpass across from the Mobil gas station.

FROM NEW JERSEY & SOUTH:
Take Garden State Parkway North onto the New York State Thruway East towards NYC/Tappan Zee Bridge. Then follow above directions.

FROM NEW YORK CITY, BRONX, BROOKLYN, QUEENS AND LONG ISLAND:
Take the Tri-Borough Bridge to the Major Deegan Expressway, where you join the New York State Thruway (Interstate 87 North). Cross over the Tappan Zee Bridge to Nyack, Exit 11. Hotel/Lounge is located immediately on your right.

FROM NEW YORK CITY AND MANHATTAN:
Take the George Washington Bridge West to New Jersey, Upper Level. Take the first exit onto the Palisades Parkway North to Exit 9E, New York State Thruway East towards NYC/Tappan Zee Bridge. Take Nyack, Exit 11, then follow above directions.

FROM UPSTATE NEW YORK AND NORTH:
New York Thruway South (87 S/287 East) to Nyack, Exit 11, then follow above directions.

FROM NEW ENGLAND AND WESTCHESTER:
Take the Connecticut Turnpike (Interstate 95) or the Merritt Parkway to the Cross Westchester Expressway (I-287). Take the Cross Westchester Expressway West to and over the Tappan Zee Bridge. Take Nyack, Exit 11. At the end of the ramp, make a right. Hotel/Lounge is located on the right.

Contact Us:
Jimmy Parseghian or Lisa  Dosch
WEST GATE LOUNGE
BEST WESTERN NYACK ON HUDSON
26 ROUTE 59 and Exit 11 of NY Thruway I-87
NYACK, NEW YORK 10960

Located on Rt 59 directly across the street from the Mobile Station

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating in the backroom starts at 9:30 and the show starts shortly after.
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet @ La Fama. We are here every Friday For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class, after admission is also on. Admission: $10 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by teh instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/

Weekly Karaoke Fridays at Action Burger and $30 open bar night.  Bring your friends and bring your singing voice.  There will be random Anime on one television and Karaoke for the Xbox on another television (Karaoke revolution, American idol and more).  Below are the drinks available for the open bar.  

Open bar isn't required for meetup.  But a $10 minimum food or drink is required for each RSVP member. 

There will also be card games and board games available for members.  Some of the games:  Cards against humanity, Superfight, Monopoly, Scrabble, pie in face, chess, hungry hippo, uno, spades and more. 

Get a free shot for every two songs you sing.  


$30 open bar from 11pm-2am includes:


Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

Food menu at Action Burger:

https://www.facebook.com/Action.Burger/photos/a.589240747858792.1073741833.256556391127231/810328379083360/?type=3&theater

Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"

***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

results.description:
The Great Backyard Bird Count is happening this Friday through Monday.

Let's participate by going for a Saturday bird walk!

We'll walk from Pier 1 to Pier 5 and can expect to see:

-Bufflehead
-Gadwall
-Great Black-backed Gull
-White-throated Sparrow
-and more!

Bring binoculars if you have them. 


Meet in park where Old Fulton Street ends/intersects with Furman St. (BargeMusic) at 8:30am. Map 

Closest Subways are:
A/C at High St.
F at York St.
2/3 at Clark St.

Note: I won't be checking my phone for text  or meetup messages once the walk begins. If you arrive after 8:30am, you can call me at[masked] or look for anyone with binoculars walking around Pier 1, especially at south end along East River (near pilings in water).


Also, I'll be there to lead the walk rain or shine or snow.

For birding tips, giveaways, and updates on my upcoming book, sign up for my email list here.


See you Saturday!

~Heather


Coming June 14th...



Available for Pre-order now!

results.description:
A Writer's Affair

Improve your relationship with your typewriter or tablet (pen or pencil) the day before Valentine's Day at ...

THE NATIONAL WRITERS UNION'S 
5TH ANNUAL NEW YORK WRITERS CONFERENCE

* Lure new readers using proven techniques from nationally recognized literary trailblazer Troy Johnson.
* Defend your work by getting detailed information about protecting your copyright from Susan E. Davis, national contract advisor co-chair for the National Writers Union's Book Division.
* Learn insider tactics for increasing your discoverability from Miral Sattar, Founder & CEO of Bibliocrunch, the online platform for authors that caught the attention of the BBC, Consumers Report, and Forbes.
* Multiple afternoon sessions designed to offer 30-minute consultations with Poets & Writers' Bonnie Rose Marcus, editorial powerhouse Marcela Landres, President of Black Hawk Literary Agency LLC Jan L. Kardys, self-publishing guru Timothy Sheard, social media expert Jo Anne Meekins, Esther Cohen who will explain the advantages of nonprofit sponsorship (there are more than what many think), and professional graphic artist Lallan Schoenstein. You'll get to talk to all of them.

All this will cost you less than a large box of chocolates. Plus you'll get more than candy to eat. Conference fees include a continental breakfast, a delicious lunch from award-winning Comfort Foods, and a closing reception.

Register early. Space is limited to 75. Year after year our conference attendees filled every chair we have.

CONFERENCE REGISTRATION: $20 for union members, $25 for students (student ID required) and seniors (65 and over); $40 for general admission. If you join the NWU during the program you will receive a $20.00 discount.

REGISTER ONLINE: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2492499

To register and pay at the door, email: [masked].

Why join the National Writers Union?

The National Writers Union UAW Local 1981 is the only labor union that represents writers of all genres.

NWU members enjoy many benefits. Membership fees start at $12.50 per month.

Featured Benefits:

* Free contract advice and grievance support.
* Good, affordable health care.
* Free table space at the Brooklyn Book Festival, Harlem Book Fair, and the NYC Poetry Festival.
* Free access to large space for book launches.
* Free web listing on nwu.org and access to archived videos of past seminars.
* Publicity for your events on Meetup.
* Exclusive access to advice-packed listservs.
* Discounts through Union Plus.
* IFJ International Press Pass.

To join online, visit nwu.org.
results.name: A Writer's Affair: NWU's 5th Annual Conference

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Learn JavaScript Fundamentals w/ In-Person Instruction!

Fullstack's JavaScript Jumpstart is a full-day course that teaches the "ABCs" of programming and JavaScript.

WHO IS THIS COURSE FOR? 

It's designed for students with little programming experience who want to get a "jumpstart" on their journey toward becoming a Fullstack developer. This course is also a great way to prepare for Fullstack Academy's admissions interviews. 

HOW IS THE COURSE STRUCTURED? WHAT IS THE SCHEDULE? 

The course will run over 1 Saturday, all day -- covering JavaScript fundamentals. Each concept will be covered by a practical hands-on workshop. You'll develop core programming skills and use them to build a cool final project, which will be created remotely.  

HOW SHOULD I PREPARE FOR JUMPSTART?

All students will need to complete the first 5 units of codecademy.com's JavaScript track (approximately 4-5 hours) before the class.  Students are also required to bring their own laptop - either Mac or Windows is fine.

IS JAVASCRIPT JUMPSTART AN IN-PERSON OR REMOTE CLASS?

ADVISORY: THERE WILL BE NO REMOTE OPTION FOR THE FEBRUARY JUMPSTART CLASS

Live/In-Person - Jumpstart is taught at Fullstack Academy's campus in downtown NYC. Choose this option to attend all 3 evenings in-person, get in-person instruction and TA assistance, and see the Fullstack campus.

HOW MUCH DOES THE COURSE COST?

Tuition for this course is $295

HOW CAN I REGISTER? 

You must register through Eventbrite to secure a spot in the class.Head to the link below to signup for the class. Exclusively for our Meetup group members - Use the coupon code "jsmeetup" to take15% off the price!

**Event Signup Link: https://february-jumpstart-2016.eventbrite.com**

** More Info:JSNP Class Details**  

Class space is limited, sign up today to secure your spot!

<a href="https://february-jumpstart-2016.eventbrite.com"></a>

results.description:
Event Name: Claudius Smith's Rock Loop from Tuxedo

Leader: Tom G

Event Type: Hike

Location: Tuxedo

Maps: Southern Harriman  Bear Mountain #118

Basics:

This loop hike climbs to several panoramic viewpoints, including Claudius Smith’s Rock.   

Details Time:  5+ hours ( this is always a  good guess)

Difficulty: Moderate to Strenuous   

Length: 8.5 miles  

 Features: Views   

Park: Harriman-Bear Mountain State Parks Region: Harriman-Bear Mountain State Parks Region

Elevation Gain: Moderate

RSVP Details:. Please write in comments of your RSVP if you are driving and from where or needing a carpool. Please update your RSVP if you cannot attend at least a day prior to event, unless an emergency.

.

Required Gear: 

Waterproof hiking boots or shoes and a change of socks as we have small water crossings.


Microspikes or other foot traction devices are mandatory!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

Gloves ,Hat and other winter weather appropriate clothing'

As the forecast is calling for very cold temp's so be prepared

Hiking poles if you have them

Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries

At least 2.5 liters of water. -

Lunch and snacks.

Guidelines if carpooling: split gas and tolls

Directions: GPS[masked], [masked]

Follow N.J. Route 17 north to the New York State Thruway and take Exit 15A (Sloatsburg). Turn left at the bottom of the ramp onto N.Y. Route 17 north, and continue for 4.9 miles, passing through the villages of Sloatsburg and Tuxedo. Just past the Tuxedo railroad station, turn right onto East Village Road, cross the tracks, and turn left into a commuter parking lot (free parking on weekends; $2.00 parking fee on weekdays).

For those coming by public transportation:. Bus riders take the 8:30 Short Line bus from PABT NY which Arrives at  9:19. Buy a one way bus ticket. The short line ticket office is on the second floor of the North Building of the PABT. The bus usually leaves from gate 403.

results.description:
* Visit our NYC Dads Group website for more events, news and tales from the dad side! * 


This is an incredible opportunity for members of the NYC Dads Group!  Play Fair NY invited 20 NYC Dads Group members along with ONE child to immerse themselves in the first ever PlayFair at the Jacob Javits Center! 


Play Fair presented by LEGO and Nickelodeon is a celebration of play and entertainment for all ages. It’s an immersive, experience-rich event for children, parents, families, and teenage and adult collectors. With hands-on exhibits, awe-inspiring displays, dozens of toy and entertainment brands, and never-before-seen exclusives, attendees can feel, touch, and take home their favorite toys and games — and be the first to glimpse the toys of tomorrow.

LEGO and Nickelodeon Come to Life at Play Fair!

The first ever Play Fair comes to the Javits Center on February 13-14 in New York City! Play Fair will feature the best of toys, games, and family entertainment - like a Comic Con for Kids!


Play Fair is presented by LEGO and Nickelodeon and features Hasbro, Mattel, Cartoon Network, Crayola, Toys"R"Us, and more.  

Kick off February break in the biggest play room ever...

·  Meet the PAW Patrol, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, SpongeBob SquarePants, Peppa Pig, and PJ Masks

·  See the new Batmobile from the upcoming film Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

·  Build and race your own LEGO car

·  Make comics with award-winning comic creators

·  Watch at the Story Pirates bring children's stories to life

·  Make comics with award-winning comic creators Art Baltazar, Franco Aureliani, Dave Roman, and Abby Denson

·  Snap a selfie with your favorite family YouTubers

We’ll see you at Play Fair!

* 20 NYC Dads Group members will receive a PAIR of tickets (good for dad + 1 kid).  The lucky 20 dads will get a follow up email in the first week of February with detailed instructions on receiving tix.

* FREE opportunity (a $60 value)

* For those dads who would like to bring family members beyond the 2 free tickets, there is a $5 discount code. To save $5 on each ticket you buy at www.playfairny.com, use code CityDads5.

PlayFair is in Javits North, the newest (and North-most) building in the Javits complex. Enter at West 39th and 11th Ave.

PlayFair will be operating all weekend (Feb 13 and 14) with four different sessions.  NYC Dads Group will be attending session #1 on Saturday, Feb 13 from 9:30am - 1:30pm

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

ADMISSION FEE: $3.00 for Queens LP members; $5.00 for Non-Members.

If you are driving, arrive early to look for free street parking. There are also many 2-hour Muni-Meter spots and a nearby parking lot.

If you are coming by subway, use the IRT "7" Flushing Line and exit at 74th Street/Broadway. You can also use the IND "E", "F" or "R" Queens Blvd. Lines and exit at the Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue stop.

If you get lost, call Dr. Tom Stevens on his cell phone at[masked]-7075.

results.description:
Celebrate over 3 decades of My Little Pony magic and friendship in the Greatest City in the world!


For Ponycon 2016 the headliner guest is none other than LAUREN FAUST herself! Joining her will be BONNIE ZACHERLE, creator of the original My Little Pony toys. Two creators, one amazing weekend! 

Also appearing: 

ASHLEIGH BALL - Voice of Rainbow Dash, Applejack & Lyra! 

Special Musical Guest
LENA HALL - Voice and singing voice of COUNTESS COLORATURA


SHANNON CHAN KENT - the singing voice of Pinkie Pie, voice actress of Silver Spoon! 

Big Macintosh & Dr Hooves voiceover actor PETER NEW! 

My Little Pony author and tv show writer G.M. BERROW!

KAZUMI EVANS - Singing voice of Rarity and Princess Luna, voice of Moondancer, Octavia Melody and Rose!

ANDREW FRANCIS - Voice of Shining Armor! 

Voice actor for Flash Sentry, VINCENT TONG!

Maud Pie, Limestone Pie & Marble Pie voice over actress INGRID NILSON!

 MLP Voice over Director TERRY KLASSEN!

Via SKYPE- Voice of Rarity, Luna, Derpy, Granny Smith, Nightmare Moon and many more: TABITHA ST. GERMAIN!

IDW Comic Book talents ANDY PRICE, TONY FLEECS, AGNES GARBOWSKA, and DIANA LETO!

and "BIG" JIM MILLER - MLP:FiM Show Director!


Now in its fourth year, Ponycon is a global gathering of fans and friends to celebrate all things Pony. Ponycon is New York City's My Little Pony fan convention! Ponycon brings the My Little Pony fan community together with performances, art exhibitions, educational workshops and more that celebrate the philosophy of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic along with the creative energy of New York City. 

Taking place in Brooklyn New York, Ponycon will offer interactive experiences and events for fans and friends of all ages, including activities, art, exhibits, exclusives, workshops, lectures, panels, sneak peeks, beauty, food, fun, and many more surprises!

Join the colorful world of MLP fandom, and meet wonderful new friends at Ponycon. As Princess Celestia said to Twilight Sparkle, "make some friends!"

***Tickets are available now!*** http://ponycon.nyc/register  

VIP Memberships are also available in limited quantities. Get cool stuff, and help our convention to grow! 

Hotel and Transportation Thread

Use the link below to post about hotel and transportation sharing
http://www.meetup.com/Bronies-NYC/messages/boards/thread/49263235/


Interested in Volunteering at Ponycon?
http://ponycon.nyc/volunteer

Announcing the PONYCON CELEBRITY BANQUET!

http://ponycon.nyc/banquet 

Our Celebrity Banquet with the stars is your chance to dine with Ponycon's top guests, from voice and production crew of the My Little Pony TV show, to IDW Comic book artists to fandom luminaries. 

Our keynote speakers are none other than the creators of My Little Pony and Friendship is Magic, Lauren Faust and Bonnie Zacherle. Presented in the luxury worthy of the Grand Prospect Hall, this will be the MLP Event of the Year! 

Got a ticket / badge question? Look HERE for fast answers!

 http://www.ponycon.nyc/ticketing

results.description:
The hike is ON.  It will be very cold, so please dress warmly in layers, and don't forget a scarf and/or neck warmer. 

MEET EVENT LEADER: Bijoy Mechery, [masked], cell day of hike only[masked]-8482.
Meet at 10 AM at Mayapple Hill parking area. Hike 2 to 2.5 hours and 4 to 5 miles. Bring snack and water. Hiking boots required. Traction devices also required if there is snow cover. Please watch this site on the morning of February 13 for any last minute changes/cancellations.
If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
DIRECTIONS:
From north of the park (either eastbound or westbound) on I-280: Take exit 7. At the bottom of the ramp, Turn south (left) onto Pleasant Valley Way. Proceed 2.2 miles to the corner of Pleasant Valley Way and Northfield Ave. Turn right on Northfield. Go 0.1 miles and turn right into park road for Mayapple Hill.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! results.description:
In our hectic modern life, feelings of loneliness and separation can be a painful struggle for many. Metta, or Lovingkindness, is a traditional meditation that cultivates our inherent qualities of love, kindness and friendliness to all beings, including ourselves. Whether you're single or in a relationship, old or young, join us for a special,  practice-based meditation retreat designed to reacquaint you with your heart and the loving connection we share with each other.

Kimberly Brown and Mona Chopra will be leading this Valentine's Day offering, which will include seated and walking meditation, instruction, and group discussion. Chairs will be provided. Note we are located on the second floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.

Register by 2/6 for discounted price of $50.  Details and Registration: http://theidproject.org/events/2016/02/13/lovingkindness-daylong-retreat


Benefits of Lovingkindness Meditation: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/emma-seppala-phd/18-sciencebased-reasons-t_b_5823952.html
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Retreat Day (Paid)

results.description:
This is our indoor circuit Training session to prepare NJDBC members for the 16th Annual indoor paddle regatta competition on Saturday April 2nd 2016 as well as for the 2016 Dragon Boat season on water and any competitive regatta races from April to October. 


The circuit training session will be conducted by our team captain Dave L. and current Dragon Boat Team USA member Greg and is OPEN TO ANY GUY OR GAL in good physical condition who would be interested in paddling, meeting new people, and joining NJDBC. 


Circuit training will include several workout stations such as burpees, weights, push-ups, planks, paddling, etc.  A couple of the circuit stations will be a paddle machine. This will allow you to get a taste of  paddling in a Dragon Boat, outrigger, or canoe! The workout will conclude with a fun  2000 meter Paddle Erg team relay race.


Please have a light breakfast well before the workout and bring a drink & towel.  We will provide introductions and demonstrate proper form before we start.


We work hard together, paddle hard together, eat together, & have fun together!

Disclaimer:


Consult your physician before starting this or any other fitness program. You should be in good physical condition and be able to participate in exercise. Though we practice proper form, safety, and caution, you the user, will assume all risks of injury.  If you engage in this exercise program, you agree that you do so at your own risk, are voluntarily participating in these activities, assume all risk of injury to yourself, and agree to release and discharge NJDBC and LPPOA from any and all claims or causes of action, negligence, known or unknown.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
It is a very exciting time for particle physics...what with the expected announcement on February 11th of the discovery of the gravitatonal waves!

http://www.nature.com/news/gravitational-waves-5-cosmic-questions-they-can-tackle-1.19337


This week we will extend the discussion of last week, which touched on Noether's Theorem and the Lagrangian of electromagnetism.  We will begin with a brief review, and proceed to discuss why the A field must be massless.  Then we will turn to non-abelian gauge symmetries (Yang-Mills theories) which are associated with conserved quantities like isospin.

We'll round out the discussion with some detailed treatment of the Dirac Equation, gamma matrices, Clifford algebra so...etc.

No meetup would be complete at this time without a less technical overview of the groundbreaking discoveries at LIGO.

Again, familiarity with the foundations of classical field theory and quantum mechanics will be required.

We hope to continue on this path for the next few meetups, so stay tuned. Look forward to seeing you there!

Some recommended readings...

http://www.nikhef.nl/~t45/ftip/Ch12.pdf


http://www.damtp.cam.ac.uk/user/ch558/pdf/Gauge_theories.pdf


http://www-personal.umich.edu/~jbourj/peskin/group%20project.pdf


Chapter 15 of Peskin and Schroeder
results.name: Gauge Theories and the Standard Model of Particle Physics Part III

results.description:
The Collective invites you to our first "One Day Intensive Seminar of 2016! Members receive an advance opportunity to sign up so reserve your seat now by sending an email with "LICENSING" in the subject to: [masked]. “ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT SONG & MUSIC LICENSING”

DATE: SATURDAY, February 13th

TIME: 11AM – 4:30 PM

LOCATION: Planet Studio NYC 244 West 54th Street, Suite 800B (between Broadway & 8th Ave)

WORKSHOP FEE: $125.00

The licensing of music and songs for TV & Film is a mainstay for songwriters and publishers looking to generate income from their song catalogs. This one day intensive seminar will focus on the creative and business essentials you need to know to target this market.

The morning session will focus on the business of songwriting in music licensing with the Collective’s founder Peter Bliss. Bring your questions!!! The afternoon session will feature a visit with Steven Scharf, Sr. VP of Creative for the Film and Television division of Carlin America and head of Steven Scharf Entertainment (SSE). Steven oversees the licensing of well-established songwriters and artists such as AC/DC, Jim Steinman (Meat Loaf), The Lovin' Spoonful, The Turtles, James Brown, Bobby Darin and Billie Holiday. SSE has evolved to include the music licensing of many up and coming new artists for film and television. Participants will have the opportunity to introduce themselves and play a song for review.

There will be a 1/2 hr lunch break / Shops and restaurants available nearby.

Parking garage between Broadway and 8th Avenue with access from 53rd St.(heading west) & 54th St.(heading east)

------

The next Collective Song Club is scheduled for Wednesday, January 20th from 5:30-8:30pm. The Song Club is living up to it's goal of becoming a supportive, creative community. For all the info click HERE. To our regular Song Club participants , please mark your calendars that the meeting the beginning of February will be on TUESDAY, February 2nd from 5:30-8:30pm instead of Wednesday the 3rd.

The School of Driving is here to announce its February location drawing event, for one and all! Join us to draw at The Brooklyn Museum on Saturday, February 13th.


*We will meet that day at the Brooklyn Museum, by the Rodin Bronze Sculptures in the Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Pavilion, 1st Floor (to the right of the entrance) at 11 a.m. and stay until 5:30 p.m. This is a free event on our end, though The Brooklyn Museum is a suggested donation museum. Only pay what you are able to afford.

*The BK Museum does not allow backpacks within the museum and will insist they be checked. Messenger or tote bags are your best bet for hauling your supplies.

*The museum cafes are a bit expensive. Consider brown bagging lunch or going out to one of the local shops on Washington Ave, just a 2 minute walk from the museum.

*There will be a mid-day work share at 2:00 p.m. at the Beaux-Art Court on the 3rd floor. The location of the mid-day meetup may be changed based on crowds and access. Any location changes will be announced on the fbook group page the day of the event.

*Final crit will begin at around 5:30 p.m. that evening in the Great Hall on the 1st floor by the KAWS sculpture. Again, any changes will be announced throughout the day.


**For those of you coming from within the city, or for those from LI who prefer to take the LIRR to Atlantic Terminal: the 2/3 is the closest subway to The BK Museum. Take either to the 'Eastern Pkwy/Brooklyn Museum' stop, and the museum entrance is upstair.

***For those who prefer drive, see the museum website for directions. There is usually street parking that time of day in front of the park on Eastern Pkwy, as alternate side ends at 10:30a.m.


https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/visit/directions/


We had a great time last month at the The Met and some super cool pieces were created that day, so we are looking forward to another day of creative fun! If you have any further questions, please contact me. Thank you everyone and we hope to see you there.
