results.description:
Foundations of Mindfulness - The Breath

Congratulations to our Meditation and Mindfulness in Bay Ridge community.  One year ago we started sharing practices from Buddhist traditions that have helped us let go of the dissatisfactions in daily life and live with more ease. I'm so grateful for the heartfelt and generous kindness everyone has brought to the group and look forward to continuing along the path. This week we will continue our discussions on the Foundations of Mindfulness and explore how and why the Breath is used as a primary meditation object. Thich Nhat Hahn explains that the "breath is the bridge which connects life to consciousness, which unites your body to your thoughts."

In meditation practice we learn that being with the breath is an experience we feel directly in the body; we are not just thinking about what breath is like. When we are "in" the experience of breathing we also see it is not stable, but is always changing and flowing. As we see the changeability or impermanence of the breath, we also begin to see the changeability or impermanence of all things. Right there In this midst of constant change is where the breath becomes our home base and resting place.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Foundations of Mindfulness - the Breath

results.description:
In February, I am going to teach Sake Kasu, which has been used for centuries in Japan to marinate fish and pickle vegetables. Because of its probiotic element, it brings a uniquely deep flavor to dishes in addition to helping you to stay healthy and restful!


During the Sake making process, Moromi (fermented rice mash) is pressed and let to ferment. The mash that remains contains up to 9% alcohol and rich probiotic elements. This mash is the Sake Kasu. During the Winter times in Japan we eat a lot of dishes with Sake Kasu to help stay cozy and warm.

Note: The class is especially good for people who enjoy  Sake and cheese type flavors.

The menu:
Sake Kasu paste
Sake Kasu chocolate pudding
Sake Kasu creamy soup with vegetables
Seasonal vegetable salad with a Sake Kasu dressing
Crimni Mushrooms with Sake Kasu White Miso Paste
Sake Kasu Miso Marinated Fish
results.name: Let's make some dishes in Sake-kasu!

Cupid’s Undie Run is a mile(ish) run in your bedroom-best on Valentine’s weekend. No, we’re not crazy, we’re just crazy serious about raising money for The Children’s Tumor Foundation. Come put the hilarity in charity with hundreds of half-naked runners taking to the streets in celebration of their fundraising for CTF.

Be a part of something great. Last year Cupid's raised over $1.3 Million to end NF and we're relying on YOU to join and make this year's fundraising (and party) the biggest and best yet.

Start a team, join a team, or just run solo and make some new friends!

The party starts at 12:00pm , run time is 2:30pm , then back for more fun until 5:00pm . Arrive early and stay late... and feel free to remain pants-less the entire time!

http://www.cupidsundierun.com/info/faq/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=7XmOYk4eEPI
results.name: ❤︎~Cupid's Undie Charity Run 1 mile~❤︎

results.description:
Here's a video from our last performance; "Santa Baby"


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Eq5zNQPuFw

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (16 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $380  (you save $50 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

All you need is love and some Beatles!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
It's that time of year when we celebrate the brutal torture and murder of a priest in ancient Rome with flowers and chocolate!   Anyway, this meetup won't have any of that stuff.  It's all about getting your nerd on at one of Park Slope's best bars with some of Brooklyn's finest people. 

    Can you and your partner cooperate in "Whitewater?"

Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!

       Whiskey and "Nuns on the Run"--a solid combination

What are we going to play?

It'll be mostly the usual fare of games like Medina,  Nuns on the Run, Avalon, Steam Park, Coup...  These are relatively simple modern board games that have a quick rules explanation and play in less than an hour.

Anything new?

Glad you asked!  I'll definitely have Asteroyds.  In Asteryods you have to decide where your space ship needs to go to avoid all this space stuff.  Except the asteroids are moving.  And you have a matter of seconds to figure it out!  I may also have "Keep Talking and No One Dies."  Enough said...

If you're really curious about what I might bring, probe the nerdy depths of my collection and visit my Board Game Geek page.  The bar does have a nice copy of Catan on hand as well. 

What, no Sorry or Pictionary?

This particular meetup focuses on new board games (post-Settlers of Catan, 1994).  I know a lot of people like the old classics like Trouble, Uno, Monopoly and Taboo but in my humble opinion, new games are designed better, are more fun, easy to learn and play much quicker than your childhood classics.  If you come with an open mind willing to try something new, I think you'll really like the new kids on the block.  I should add, I will flat out refuse to play Cards Against Humanity.  I love edgy, provocative comedy but these guys put into words my feelings on the game better than I could do here.  Sorry to be a downer.

     Two elk confront each other in "Elchfest".  Majestic.

I'm barely getting out of bed when this is starting!

I know that noon on a Saturday is a bit early for people--I get it, believe me--but as long as you show up by 4 (or even 5) you should be able to get some gaming in.

Food and Drink

Skylark is a great bar in Park Slope in its own right.  They have some good bar food but are also open to outside food as long as we clean up.  They have been tremendous hosts so have a drink, a little nosh and tip well!  

Contact

My phone number is listed near the top of this posting if you have any questions day-of.  And with that we'll see you there!  Or else...

                 Point guns at each other in Ca$h 'n Gun$

(This picture refuses to stay rotated.  Still kinda works though)
results.how_to_find_us: At the tables in the back.  516 314-0228

results.description:
As another season of dolphin slaughter draws to a close, Sea Shepherd Conservation Society is calling on volunteers, supporters and concerned individuals around the world to join with us and our Sea Shepherd Cove Guardians as we show our love for dolphins and call for an end to the captive dolphin trade that funds the slaughter of cetaceans in Taiji’s infamous cove.

On Saturday, February 13, Sea Shepherd will teach the world about the link between captivity and the cove and encourage local businesses to stop supporting the hunt with peaceful World Love for Dolphins Day demonstrations across North America and overseas. Sea Shepherd chapters will host demos at local businesses that profit directly from the dolphin slaughter by trading on their surviving family members and stand in solidarity with Sea Shepherd’s volunteer Cove Guardians currently on the ground in Taiji. On Valentine's weekend, animal lovers across the globe will show the world that there is nothing to love about captivity.

In New York City, we will be outside Liberty Travel Union Square Mega Shop, 25 W 14th St, between 5th and 6th Avenues.

Liberty Travel currently sells packages that include encounters with wild-caught captive dolphins at Delphinus Xcaret, Delphinus Xel-ha and Dolphin Discovery Isla Mujeres. Delphinus' parent company has even petitioned the government to import dolphins directly from Taiji where the income from live, trained dolphins is used to directly fund the murder of their family members. If we end captivity, we end the slaughter.

If you can't make it to a demonstration, take a selfie photo with one of our posters and send it to us. We will post your selfies on our social media pages to proudly display your love for dolphins! Please email photos to: [masked]. Please send us your photos by February 14, 2015 at midnight EST.
results.name: World Love for Dolphins Day

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com
results.name: Eating Disorders NYC Meetup Monthly Meetup

results.description:
Bollywood Funk NYC is back and the weather gods have finally smiled upon us. So lets get ready and start our first Naach  Xpress class in Jersey City for the year 2016. New to dancing? Don't worry. Just take a chance at dance and we are sure you will have a lot of fun at this class.

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! 


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g 

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

results.description:
Future VSU Dates!

*FEBRUARY 13TH (PBRS)
*MARCH 12TH (PBRS)
*APRIL 16TH (PBRS)

If you haven't been to this monthly event, you should go!  It's a lot of fun.  Plenty of food vendors & vendors selling cruelty-free products...all at a very cool bar.

"Pine Box Rock Shop is a vegan-friendly bar. Owned and operated by two vegans (and one vegan-friendly), Pine Box Rock Shop proudly carries only products containing no animal ingredients. To some, this may conjure images of an indignant barkeep shaking his or her finger and refusing the delivery of a case of pork-infused vodka. In reality (and sadly), many companies that produce spirits, beers, wines and sodas unnecessarily incorporate the use of gelatin, isinglass (fish bladders), carmine (ground beetles) and other "ingredients" for filtration or presentation-related reasons. You will find none of those products at our bar."

"In addition to company provided items, Pine Box Rock Shop also provides in-house alternatives to traditionally non-vegan bar favorites such as Bloody Mary’s (some of the best in the city, vegan or not, so we’ve been told!) and our own homemade Irish Creme. Ever had a cruelty-free Car Bomb? We have!"

Tables line the walls of the bar at this vegan pop-up market with baked goods, vegan wares, body care, as well as many, many food vendors to delight your taste buds. Come sample everything from freshly baked vegan goodies to salads and some Treeline Cheese!! The meetup get-together that we are having is the perfect opportunity to get a head start on your own holiday festivities -- enjoying delicious food, drinks and fun with fellow vegetarians & vegans!

Happy Birthday to us! It’s been a long journey since our first Vegan Shop-Up in February 2011, and we’re still around to tell the tale! Help us celebrate our Sixth Anniversary! Vegan Valentine’s Shop-Up! on Saturday, February 13th, 12-6pm, at everyone’s favorite vegan bar, Pine Box Rock Shop. Discover the best vegan, locally made foods and goods at NYC’s all vegan pop-up market!

Get ready for… Heart-Shaped Cakes + Boxes of Chocolates + Pink Pastries + Hot Dogs + Tempeh Burgers + Pretzel Cinnamon Buns + Grilled Cheese + Croissants + Caramels + Samosas + Artisan Cheeses + Pâtés + Pot Pies + Cannolis + Raw Foods + Brownies + Peanut Butter Cups + Macarons + Empanadas + Mac ‘n’ Cheese + Gluten-Free Sweets + Handbags + T-Shirts + Skin Care + somuchmore!

Check out BRAND NEW vendors Rockin’ Raw and Rawclates! And see the full vendor line up HERE.

As a special THANK YOU to all our loyal patrons, we’ll be giving out FREE VALENTINE GOODIE BAGS to attendees! Made possible with the generous support of Justin’s, Surf Sweets, and Cocomels!

Cozy up with your sweetheart or find one there, we’ll keep you warm and friendly with award winning Bloody Mary’s from the bar. But if you’re under 21 you can only enter the market with a parent or legal guardian, so plan accordingly. Our next all ages VSU is coming up at MooShoes!

Take this opportunity to SAVE THE DATE for the next VSU’s! See more dates in the sidebar.

– FEBRUARY 28TH (MOOSHOES – All Ages)
– MARCH 12TH (PBRS)

VEGAN LOVERS UNITE.

Hugs + Kisses,
VSU
results.name: Vegan Shop-up in Brooklyn

results.description:
Based on feedback from regular group members, we're implementing a new structure and name!

We're combining our monthly music technology education meetup with the broader work of the NYU Music Experience Design Lab. Instead of starting at 10am, we'll kick off at Noon with socializing and free food and drink. We'll have a planned program from 12:30-2pm, followed by Open Lab from 2-5pm.

Come and share something your working on, find like minded collaborators in the music/arts/technology/education space, share exemplars of projects you're implementing with your students, or share the latest progress and demos from your startup!

We strongly encourage teachers to bring motivated students to share their work.

Program:

12:00 - 12:30pm - Food, Refreshments, Conversation

12:30 - 2pm - Workshop: Using LEGO to stimulate creative thinking, ideation, making, and learning.

2:00 - 5pm - OPEN LAB

Open Lab Public Events:

- Free working time

- Ed Sullivan Fellows Program (6th floor of 35 W 4th St.)

Special thanks to NYU Leslie eLab for hosting us!

#nymusicteched
results.how_to_find_us: The eLab is at the corner of Washington Place and Greene St.
results.name: Monthly NYC Music Experience Design Meetup & Open Lab

results.description:
In the video of this lecture, Briony Fer, Professor of History of Art at University College London, looks at Malevich’s systemic method, as it was elaborated in his work, writings, and teachings, and its ongoing relevance for subsequent generations of artists. Malevich’s late work is examined as an intricate set of reflections on some of the problems raised by the systems that he set in the 1910s. Additionally, Fer argues that the Brazilian avant- garde of the late 1950s offers a radically reconfigured and innovative view of the significance of Malevich’s work and its historical repercussions, which repays close attention today. See link below:

https://video.ias.edu/node/5754


This lecture is part of an art history lecture series cosponsored by the Institute for Advanced Study and the Department of Art and Archaeology at Princeton University.

We suggest a donation of 2 or 3 dollars at the meetup to cover the expenses of maintaining this group's web presence. No profit is made from running this group.
results.how_to_find_us: 47 Fifth Ave. between 11-12 Streets. 2 blocks south of Union Sq.
results.name: Malevich's Nervous System

I will guide you on how to create a painting of anything you want. 

Show me your inspiration and I will share with you the techniques to create a painting of your dreams! Any style, any medium: acrylics, oils, watercolors or gouache.
Your two hour art lesson will be personalized to meet your needs. Perfect for friends, families, couples, or your next organization or business outing.
Just bring your ideas and creativity!

*Laura Baran is a New York City artist with a BFA in Illustration from the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her work has won numerous awards, including Excellence in Painting from the New York City Society of Illustrators and the ranking of #1 Movie Poster of 2014 by TimeOut New York.

results.description:
Our next meetup will focus on: Self-Determination.

The meetup runs as follows:


1) The moderator selects one subject for discussion and a date for the meeting. Subjects can be as ephemeral as "love," "god," and "purpose," or as grounded as "politics," "environmentalism," and "family."

2) At the meetup, people are encouraged to propose a question related to the subject. The moderator will collect all of the questions in a list. Questions may also be proposed ahead of time online on the event page.

3) The group will then vote on the questions. In the first round of voting, each individual may vote for as many questions as they like. The top three will then go to a second round, where each individual may vote just once.

4) The question with the most votes is then discussed. Often, the discussion starts with a narrowing of the question, as it can be challenging to devise a question that can possibly be answered by a small group in just a couple of hours' discussion.

Finally, please consider making a small donation to help the moderator cover subscription costs.

results.description:
Dear Caring Activists Against Fur,

As you may know, the weather will be quite chilly on Saturday. So, we are making some adjustments. We may not be staying out until 3:00, so if you arrive late, you may miss the demo. It is more likely, we will stop at 2:30. Also, because of the weather, we will not be able to set up the TV. So, if you want to be part of the action, from the beginning, please do the following.

We meet in front of the Time Warner Building at Columbus Circle at 1:00 - you will get a heart shaped sign/banner, etc.
At 1:15 - we march (with police escort)
1:30 - we arrive at Bergdorf Goodman 5th Ave, by 57th (if you miss the march, wait in a warm spot until we arrive)

Again, do your best to meet us on time, as we will march and be impassioned enough to provide body warmth. Also, this type of weather is an important reminder of the plight of the fur bearing animals who are trapped in outdoor cages on fur farms in ALL weather, with no care for their comfort. We will march for them and make a real impact on the people we pass. Looking forward to seeing you at this continued important tradition!

For the Animals,
Julie (Caring Activists Against Fur)
www.caafgroup.com

Let shoppers know that there is NOTHING romantic about fur! On the weekend before Valentine’s Day, please join for our annual march down Central Park South, past the exclusive shops and hotels, spreading our message of compassion.

Activists are invited to gather at Columbus Circle between 1:00 and 1:15pm. At 1:15, those gathered will march down Central Park South to Bergdorf-Goodman 754 Fifth Avenue (between 57th and 58th Streets), where the protest will be staged from 1:30-3pm.

WHERE: Bergdorf Goodman, 5th Ave btwn 57th & 58th Sts, NYC.

WHEN: Saturday, February 13th, 2016.

TIME: 1 ~ 3pm

DETAILS: Activists are invited to gather at Columbus Circle between 1:00 and 1:15pm. At 1:15, those gathered will march to Bergdorf-Goodman, where the protest will be staged from 1:30-3pm. WE will have plenty of heart-shaped signs, literature and relevant props to share with interested members of the general public. All YOU need to bring is yourself and your voice to speak up for the voiceless, who cannot articulate their own wish to freely live out their lives under the sun, to frolic and to bear young, to behave in accordance with their own natures with no interference from our species. Come out and be a voice for the voiceless!

As the weather slowly moves in a warmer direction, please come and help us get the word out that compassion is the fashion, and fur is DEAD! Caring Activists Against Fur (CAAF), will be making our immutable opposition to the horrific Chinese fur trade known to those unscrupulous cretins whose livelihood is the confinement, torture and extraordinarily brutal extermination of innocent beings - all in the name of fickle "luxury" and transient, superfluous "fashion."

Come and add your voice to a burgeoning group of energetic animal activists whose prime directive is to elevate public awareness about the plight of innumerable defenseless foxes, minks, raccoons, dogs and cats and other mammal victims of the gruesome Chinese fur trade, who are violently and systematically removed from their natural habitats, corralled into inescapable death camps, crammed into tiny, filthy cages for months in ALL weather conditions, beaten, stomped on, anally electrocuted, gassed, bludgeoned to death, even SKINNED ALIVE so that affluent first-world consumers can gleefully, obliviously parade around, morbidly draped in the skins that are, quite literally, ripped off these animals' backs as they helplessly writhe in overwhelming shock and agony 'til the final throes of death overtake them. These pathetic, skinless creatures will often suffer in mortal agony for minutes or hours - all for vain, pretentious, human notions of "luxury apparel" and "fashion."

</a>

<a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLcgxIGTFRs&feature=related">WHAT: **CAAF Have A Heart! Valentine's Day Wknd fur march/protest**

WHERE: Gather 1:00 Columbus Circle & March down Central Park South @1:15 to Bergdorf Goodman, 5th Ave btwn 57th & 58th Sts, NYC - protest 1:30 - 3:00

WHEN: Saturday, February 13th, 2016.

TIME: 1:00 Columbus Circle, 1:30 - 3:00 Bergdorf Goodman

Jump into the ongoing campaign to STOP this insanity and work toward the total abolition of the global fur industry. Come out and HELP US make a vocal, public impact for the animals trapped and languishing in this insidious death trade, and to send a meaningful message to the heartless people who line their pockets with blood and entrails, who build their posh castles with the unspeakable screams of terror and suffering from countless innocent beings. For those unfamiliar with the realities of the horrible global fur trade, please take a few minutes to watch the following

Warning: Graphic imagery!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mkw_OUnVXqM

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLcgxIGTFRs

Disgusting? Horrible? Unforgivable? Agreed, so PLEASE come and help us to vocalize our extreme objection to this inexcusable, retrograde, medieval barbarism, to discourage/deter potential fur-shoppers from patronizing this retail dealer in death and torture, to enlighten the public to the grim realities behind their whimsical, self-deluding notions of fashion, and to encourage them to make more compassionate choices in shopping for winter apparel. In a world with so many great (and more economical) cruelty-free fabrics and styles, there really is ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for this ongoing madness.

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

Bring a friend for FREE!

Special bonus extra class this weekend.  Originally I had not scheduled a class this weekend because I thought Valentine's day might deter attendance.   But most of the senior people are available,  and the day was available at the studio so...  We're having a class!

In addition, if you've paid for a semester, you can bring a friend for free.  If you pay $15 for the day, you can also bring a friend for free.  If you've got a lot of friends, you can think of it as a 2-for-1 sale.

'Speaking of that "paid for the semester" deal what's the math on that?'
I'm glad you asked.  Including this Saturday there are 11 more classes in the semester.  That works out to $9.09 per two hour class for the rest of the semester.  Now $15 a class is a bargain, but $9.09?  That's a super deal.  And to sweeten it even further, if you've already paid for a class or two this semester, we'll credit that payment against your $100!  You should do it.  It will encourage you to come every week.

We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike

results.description:
Founder of the Meetup Addresses Monozukuri  
Our Monozukuri Saturday meetup #5 is for community networking among local makers, entrepreneurs and visitors for Toy Fair 2016.  Nob Seki, Organizer & Founder of Monozukuri Saturday, will speak about why he this meetup was started by FabFoundry, a startup he co-founded in NYC in 2015.


Serial Entrepreneur in Tokyo, London & NYC
Started as an editor at Nikkei, Nob always specializes in connecting the latest technology to people. He started his business career as a high-tech editor at Nikkei but also known as a serial entrepreneur who started companies in Tokyo, London and New York City recently. He also worked as senior executive at Six Apart, a pioneer of blogging in San Francisco.

Monozukuri = Making Things
His latest startup is FabFoundry, a global startup community for makers based in NYC. This startup started the Monozukuri Saturday Meetup.

Monozukuri literally means “making things” in Japanese. But according to Patricia Pringle from Japan Intercultural Consulting, monozukuri has much more meaning. Please read the post below for details.

• Kicking off Monozukuri Saturday

Toy Fair 2016 in NYC
For those who will participate in Toy Fair 2016, this meet up is a perfect occasion to network with local makers and entrepreneurs who are interested in making things.


Agenda of the day 
The meetup #5 is for community networking, so please bring as many people who are interested in making things, the maker movement, tech innovation, business development and hobbyists! 

• Place: Room 6 at The Coffee Foundry, 186 W 4th St, New York, NY 10014

• Date: Saturday, February 13th, 2016

• Time Schedule:

• 12:30pm - 1:00pm:  Networking in Room 4

• 1:00pm - 2:00pm:  Chat by Nob Seki (in Room 4)
results.name: Monozukuri Saturday 2016 #5: Nob Seki, Organizer & Founder, Monozukuri Saturday

I will be the DM; my friends are playing a Shifter Ranger and Human Rogue. Pre-made characters are available (lvl 2) for drop-ins. Pre-made pc's include: Warforged Fighter (sword and board), Human Wizard (Artificer), Half-Elf Paladin of the Silver Flame (great weapon style), Dwarf Cleric, and Kalashtar Psionic (order of the immortal). Or you can make a level 1 pc of your own using the point buy. I will have print outs of campaign setting information, if you are not familiar with Eberron, and separate notes on mechanics, such as the new races and tons of all new Backgrounds. 

Come by and check it out.

results.description:
It's Valentine's day weekend so what better time to check out the new romantic comedy "How To Be Single".

 We will meet in the lobby at 1:45PM. I will be wearing a glowing pendent that will make it super easy to spot me. The movie starts at 2:15PM. I will be emailing more detailed instructions on how to find our group to those who RSVP.


 After the movie we can go to a local Chinese restaurant for dinner (for those who want to).

Trailer? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytTzLXX2Hek

Genre? Romantic Comedy

Cast? Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Jake Lacy, Anders Holm, Alison Brie, Leslie Mann, Damon Wayans, Jr., Nicholas Braun, Jason Mantzoukas

Synopsis? There's a right way to be single, a wrong way to be single, and then...there's Alice. And Robin. Lucy. Meg. Tom. David. New York City is full of lonely hearts seeking the right match, be it a love connection, a hook-up, or something in the middle.

And somewhere between the teasing texts and one-night stands, what these unmarrieds all have in common is the need to learn how to be single in a world filled with ever-evolving definitions of love. Sleeping around in the city that never sleeps was never so much fun.


-Mike

Hey y'all. This month we're reading The Fifth Season by N.K. Jemisin. From the synopsis:

"THIS IS THE WAY THE WORLD ENDS... FOR THE LAST TIME.

A season of endings has begun. It starts with the great red rift across the heart of the world's sole continent, spewing ash that blots out the sun. It starts with death, with a murdered son and a missing daughter. It starts with betrayal, and long dormant wounds rising up to fester. This is the Stillness, a land long familiar with catastrophe, where the power of the earth is wielded as a weapon. And where there is no mercy."

Come for the discussion, stay for the geekout! And we'll be voting for the next book afterward. See you there!

This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
This meetup is for anyone interested in taking the step towards becoming a Dive- Leader. The 1st and strongest rung on that ladder is Divemaster. if this sounds like you, RSVP now.

We will have a frank discussion and what it take to become a Divemaster.

If you are addicted to diving, this course is for you.

Why becoming a Divemaster is A good idea.

• Practice makes perfect: You get to dive dive dive and spend a lot of time helping students out above and under water. You build a high level of diving self awareness and awareness of others. 

• Pass on your knowledge.

• Be a better diver

While studying to become a Divemaster, you will learn how to solve dive problems and perform your duties with confidence and competence.

In addition to learning how to help others improve their diving skills, you will improve your own at the same time. Your skills as a scuba diver will become even more effective.

You will then take everything that you learned in the classroom and put it to use in the real world by fulfilling an internship requirement.

This portion of the course will have you working with real students who are studying for their own dive certifications on various levels, so you will get to meet these individuals and work directly with them, guiding them through everything they need to know to succeed as a confident diver in all types of diving environments, from reef dives to wreck dives and night dives.
results.name: DiveMasters Orientaion

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-inside-the-roosevelt-house-tickets-20745791220?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a private tour of the Roosevelt House in the Upper East Side — the former double townhouse of Franklin, Eleanor, and Sara Delano Roosevelt, now owned by Hunter College.

On this special experience through the Neo-Georgian landmark designed by architect Charles A. Platt, we'll explore the private spaces where some of the most iconic public policies of the 20th century were shaped — hear about Franklin’s rise to the presidency after his struggle with polio, Eleanor’s activism for civil and human rights, and Sara’s philanthropy.

As an Adventure Club exclusive, we'll get to see historic family photos and artifacts from the archive!

Afterwards, we'll grab some food and drinks in the neighborhood!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Inside the Roosevelt House

How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: Nuevo Latino food served in a colorful space in the Excelsior Hotel. They feature eight unique varieties of complimentary red and white sangria to accompany their festive brunch.

http://www.calleochonyc.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
We'll discuss and explore the age-old notion of "Inequality" in terms of:

• Age

• Disability -- mental and physical


• Economic and socioeconomic status


• Familial and martial status


• Felon status 


• Gender

• Nationality and "alienage"

• Political preference or affiliation


• Race

• Religion


• Sexual orientation

The subtopics will include:

• When is inequality just and when it is unjust?

• Is it moral and just to be in pursuit of an equal society with equal opportunities for all?

• How do we strive to be "A More Perfect Union" notwithstanding a sharp disagreement about inequality?

• Does the notion of "separate-but-equal" still exist in certain fabrics of our society?

• Inequality by de jure vs. de facto means -- does it matter?

• What is the proper role of the government in balancing the competing forces?

*** Also to the extent possible and applicable -- we'll discuss these themes in the context of the 2016 Presidential Race.

***If we run out of time to cover the above list, we'll continue the discussions in Part Two.
results.name: Philosophy & Politics: Is "Inequality"­­ inherently bad or unjust? (Part I)

results.description:
This is a group for people interested in ideas and their application to life, culture, and current events. I hope to attract a diverse group of thinkers who would like to discuss ideas in an atmosphere of civility, where we each give one anther's views a thoughtful hearing. Conversely, informal logical fallacies (ad hominem, etc.), personal attacks, or rudeness in any form will not be allowed. Our goal will be refine our understanding of our own ideas by actively engaging with others who hold different intellectual contexts.


Our first Meetup will be an opportunity to get to know one another, and to have our first discussion. At the suggestion of Jann, and with Bernie Saunders' campaign having gained momentum this week, I've chosen inequality, one of his signature issues, as our first topic. Please note, the focus of our discussion will primarily (though not exclusively) concern the philosophic, as opposed to economic, aspects of the topic. We will first differentiate the traditional concept of equality of rights from the contemporary concept of equality of condition. With this as context, we will then ask: when is equality a value? When is inequality a disvalue?

As recommended reading regarding the traditional concept of equality of rights, I'm going to do something a bit immodest and suggest that everyone take the time to read my brief essay on the political philosophy of John Locke: http://goo.gl/V6NJ3G (Over the last several years, this essay has been surprisingly popular on Google, with over 55,000 visits averaging over five minutes each.) I won't recommend any particular reading regarding the contemporary concept of equality of condition, other than to note that it is essentially an application of the philosophy of egalitarianism.
results.name: Let's meet each other and discuss our first topic, Inequality

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!
results.name: Indoor bball warm up & pickup games

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Join us on Feb 13th, 2016 when AIP visits the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine to photograph this iconic structure which is the fourth largest Christian Church in the world.

AIP has arranged for private access to this site. The entire space will be open and accessible to our group including the triforium level in the main hall. (There is about a 50 stair climb to the triforium.)

Our group will be allowed to use tripods and/or monopods. However, we need to collapse them on our climb to the triforium.

We are limiting the size of the group to 12 photographers plus AIP's Organizers to maximize our photo ops and avoid having other photographers in our line of sight.

The Cathedral of St. John the Devine, is the cathedral of the Episcopal Diocese of New York. It is located on Amsterdam Avenue between West 110th Street and 113th Street in Manhattan's Morningside Heights.

The Cathedral was designed in 1888 and construction began in 1892. It remains unfinished, with construction and restoration a continuing process.

The following images of the interior of the Cathedral will give you an idea of what you'll find to photograph on Feb. 13th, 2016.

_________________________________________

We hope you'll be able to join us.
results.name: Cathedral of St. John the Divine Private Photo Shoot-Tripods and Flash Permitted

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Come meet your potential Valentine at our Pre-Valentine's Mega Speed Dating event at Hoboken, NJ. We expect 30 men and 30 women at our event, which will be held at the spacious and gorgeous LuLu's Lounge @ The W Hoboken Hotel, Hoboken's newest and hottest venue. Each date will be 3 minutes long, and everyone will meet everyone.


How does it work?

You will go on about 30 dates! Each date will be about 3 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out! :)

Recommended ages: Women 21-35, Men 23-38

Tickets are only $30. You must RSVP to reserve your spot. We cannot accept walk-ins because we need to ensure an equal number of men and women, and seating is limited to 30 men and 30 women.

PS: We are promoting this event on several of our groups and dating sites, so don't go only by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone. Over 40 people have already purchased their tickets.

results.description:
LEZ Factor presents... "VALENTINE'S DAY BLACKOUT"

(Our biggest mixer of the year!!!)


49 GROVE    |    49 GROVE STREET    |    6 - 11PM   |    ACTIVITIES BEGIN AT 7PM 


____________

FOR TICKETS:

www.vdayblackout2016.eventbrite.com 

____________

On SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 13TH, join LEZ Factor for a night of fun and romance - 

WITH THE LIGHTS OUT!!!

Grab your cute friends – hell, come on your own if you’d like – but make sure to be there!

***IMPORTANT: Please arrive by 7PM for the singles activities!***

49 GROVE opens its doors exclusively for the ladies of LEZ Factor.  We will be indulging in a night of "love games," "mini-dates," music, and good vibes!

The super sexy venue will be entirely ours for this event!  

We'll make sure to set the mood and make sure the sounds are JUST RIGHT for a sexy night of Valentine's Day fun!

WE'RE TURNING THE LIGHTS OFF - and setting the perfect tone for romance - so come and spend your evening with us!

6PM - 11PM:

SINGLE LADIES, come take part in our fun "love games" and "mini-dates."  If you'd like to participate, PLEASE ARRIVE BY 7PM!  

We’ve structured awesome activities to help facilitate the night.  We'll practically hand-hold you through the process of meeting new women.  In other words, no need to be shy.  We’ll be there to help.

 Then, ANYTHING GOES!  Mingle, dance, or do what your heart desires - all in the company of beautiful ladies.

FOR COUPLES simply looking to hang out (or those not interested in the activities), we'd still love to have you.  You're welcome to grab a drink and watch the festivities ensue!

With beautiful women, a chill, romantic atmosphere, and fun dating activities, we can't think of a better place to be that night.

Make sure to bring your friends! We'll bring ours.  ;)

____________

FOR TICKETS:

www.vdayblackout2016.eventbrite.com 

____________


FAQs: 

Age policy? 21+

What's the typical age range for these events?  Usually, these events draw women in the 21-40 age range. 

Dress code?  None.  Wear what feels good. 

What's the nearest train?  1 to Christopher Street

What's the cost at the door? $15 (all night) 

Do I have to bring my printed Eventbrite ticket to the event? No need. We will have your name on our "advanced purchase" list at the door. 

What is the refund policy? No refunds for this event.  Sorry!

Den här månaden träffas vi på en restaurang eller krog med bra läge på Manhattan eller Brooklyn. När meetup-platsen är bestämd kommer du att få e-post med platsdetaljer.

Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska, norska eller danska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska från[masked] pm)


Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

We will meet this month at a conveniently located restaurant or bar in manhattan or Brooklyn.

At our meetups, conversation is mainly in the Scandinavian language of your choice, and therefore attendance is limited to those who can, at a minimum, hold down a simple conversation in Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. If you have any questions about what this means, please contact us.

Please RSVP respectfully. We are a real group of friends and our etiquette reflects that. If you realize you can't make it, that's fine, just update your RSVP.

results.description:
The February 13th Mixed Doubles Tennis Wine and Beer Social!

When: Saturday February 13th, 6:30 pm - 11:00 pm

Where:

TCR: The Club of Riverdale, 2600 Netherland Ave, Bronx, NY

What:

Join us for a FUN night of Mixed Doubles competition! Format will be timed rotations on 6 gorgeous indoor tennis courts in a 120,000 sq ft facility. Check-In at 6:30 pm and play time on the courts will consist of up to 3 hours from 7:00 pm - 10:00 pm.

From 10:00 pm - 11:00 pm, finish off the event with your new tennis friends and some final laughs over food, wine and beer (This has been a great highlight of the Tennis Social Event, not to be missed)

Dress:


Tennis Attire and Non-Marking Tennis Sneakers (Only)

Level of Play:

All levels of play are welcome

Beginners and Advanced Beginners will play with each other Advanced and Intermediate Players will play with each

Tennis Pros will participate with all players on the courts

Cost:

$95 Non-TCR Members: If you enroll on a Friday or Saturday before the event

$75 Non-TCR Members: If you enroll on a Thursday or prior for the event (Best Offer If Not A TCR Member)

$50 Non-TCR Member Guests: Guests can enjoy the Social and TCR facility (i.e pool, sauna, steam room, etc), but not play tennis

$50 TCR Members: Can participate in all aspects of the event

Structure:

Competition is limited to 36 Players Only

Men & Women

Singles & Couples

It will be fun, social environment that will have plenty of hitting and friendly mixed doubles competition

Itinerary of Event:

Check-In: 6:30 pm

Tennis Play: 7:00 pm - 10:00 pm

Wine & Beer: 10:00 pm - 11:00 pm

RSVP: Call[masked] or email [masked] The only way to confirm your reservation and to participate as one of the 36 players is to provide payment before the event. This event will sell out quickly, so don't delay.

The following information is needed to secure your reservation:

Name(s) of attendees:

TCR Member or Guest: Yes: $50 / No: $75 (Paying Thurs or Prior) / No: $95 (Paying Friday or Saturday) /

Credit Card Number:

CVV:Expiration:

Name as it Appears on Card:

Cardholder Address:

How to Arrive:


You may be able to get a FREE ride by sharing with another participant of the event or carpooling with others via UBER as another alternative. If so, please email, [masked] to see if there is any availability, otherwise these are the other options:

FREE Pick Up Via Car

If space is available you can meet on the North West corner (by the T-Mobile Store) at 96 Street and Broadway at 6:00 pm. Coordinate with Robert at[masked] if you would like this.

By Car on Your Own

Henry Hudson Southbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 off Henry Hudson Pkwy, turn left 180° at stop sign onto Kappock St. At second light turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Henry Hudson Northbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 of Henry Hudson Pkwy, continue off the exit onto Kappock St., then turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Manhattan East Side: Take Deegan 87 to 230th St Exit 10, left at light. Left onto Broadway under the elevated train. Make first right onto 230th st and at road end turn left onto Irwin Ave. Follow up hill and turn right onto Kappock St, first light make a right onto Netherland Ave.

By Bus from Manhattan

BxM1: Bus runs from East Midtown, Manhattan directly to the club. Manhattan pick ups start at 3 Ave/33rd St. and goes up 3rd Ave till 97s street before it goes off 3rd Avenue. Bus is scheduled to pickup every 12 to 30 minutes depending on time of day. Stops right next to club at Kappock St. and Knolls Crescent. Here goes the full bus schedule stops: http://bustime.mta.info/m/?q=BxM1

#1 Train:

Take the 1 train to 207th St. and take the 20 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

OR

Take the 1 train to 231st St. and take the 10 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

By Metro North Train

Metro-north stop at Spuytin Duyvul station, 5 minute walk to TCR.

Parking:
There is paid parking available in the Century building's garage, with TCR validation prices range from $8/2hrs, $9/3hrs, $14/over 3 hours. There is also FREE street parking available within 1 or 2 blocks of the club.

How to Enter:

TCR is located in the century building, one flight up from the parking garage. If you enter through the loading dock, it is located one flight down. If you enter through the main lobby of the building, TCR is two flights down.

Just Ring the Doorbell to allow entry.

Questions: Call[masked] and speak with your Host and Elite USPTA Certified Tennis Pro, Robert


SEE YOU ON THE COURTS...

Henry Hudson Southbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 off Henry Hudson Pkwy, turn left 180° at stop sign onto Kappock St. At second light turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Henry Hudson Northbound: Take Kappock Street exit 18 of Henry Hudson Pkwy, continue off the exit onto Kappock St., then turn left onto Netherland Ave. TCR club is located in the Century building.

Manhattan East Side: Take Deegan 87 to 230th St Exit 10, left at light. Left onto Broadway under the elevated train. Make first right onto 230th st and at road end turn left onto Irwin Ave. Follow up hill and turn right onto Kappock St, first light make a right onto Netherland Ave.

By Bus from Manhattan

BxM1: Bus runs from East Midtown, Manhattan directly to the club. Manhattan pick ups start at 3 Ave/33rd St. and goes up 3rd Ave till 97s street before it goes off 3rd Avenue.  Bus is scheduled to pickup every 12 to 30 minutes depending on time of day. Stops right next to club at Kappock St. and Knolls Crescent.  Here goes the full bus schedule stops: 

http://bustime.mta.info/m/?q=BxM1

#1 Train:

Take the 1 train to 207th St. and take the 20 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

OR

Take the 1 train to 231st St. and take the 10 bus to Kappock and Knolls Crescent.

By Metro North Train

Metro-north stop at Spuytin Duyvul station, 5 minute walk to TCR.

Parking:
There is paid parking available in the Century building's garage, with TCR validation prices range from $8/2hrs, $9/3hrs, $14/over 3 hours. There is also street parking available within 1 or 2 blocks of the club.

How to Enter:

TCR is located in the century building, one flight up from the parking garage. If you enter through the loading dock, it is located one flight down. If you enter through the main lobby of the building, TCR is two flights down.

Just Ring the Doorbell to allow entry.

Questions: Call[masked] or email [masked] and speak with your Host and Elite USPTA Certified Tennis Pro, Robert


SEE YOU ON THE COURTS...

results.description:
Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome.

The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14, 21; Dec. 5, 12, 2015
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30, 2016
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5, 2016

Spots are limited to 6 HVH members per session !


  The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm, and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit. Nose, ear plugs and goggles are helpful for rolling practice.  Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc. and bring a lock for the lockers.


Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass. If you are attending contact Audrey Jackson, Program Coordinator at:  [masked]


Parking & Direction


- From Broadway, take West 145 street all the way to the Guard at the booth of 145 street & RiverSide drive.

- Let the Guard knows that you need to get the parking permit and instruction to get to the pool and he will give you a parking slip with all instruction where to park and how to get to the pool.

- After, you will need to go back to Broadway and make right then another right on West 138 Street. Take it all the way to the end and make left at the stop sign. Then continue until you get another stop sign and make right. Go under the bridge and make your first right.

- You will go through another Guard Booth and stay to your right and follow the curve and you will see the parking lot on your left.

- Take the elevator to the top and stay on your right to find the pool


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review maps and water features carefully; understanding conditions of any trip is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. Capsizing is always a possibility when engaged in a paddling trip, be mentally prepared and know how to swim and self-rescue before going on any paddling trip.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a paddling trip (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike/paddle signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.

Note: This workshop is for both couples and singles. It does not include nudity or explicit sexual touch. All genders and sexual preferences welcome.

Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-20845355018

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Connect with us:

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/

http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/

results.description:
Ever got home and needed to whip up something in a hurry? Did you cook something that tasted great but took no time at all to make? If yes, show us! If not, come on over and we'll show you how it's done!!

You don't have to spend hours in the kitchen to create a culinary masterpiece. You will be surprised by how many recipes that you can find that use five ingredients or less, and how great they can taste!

To Participate, you should be willing to prepare a recipe that is Italian, and only uses 5 ingredients or less. Since these dishes cook quickly, guests will cook in rounds. Appetizer, Entree, and then Dessert.

I have included a couple links to give you some ideas. Feel free to use any of these or find some recipes of your own.

http://www.today.com/food/do-you-go-ikea-just-meatballs-1C8541730


http://www.redbookmag.com/food-recipes/advice/g193/easy-pasta-recipes/

This is a group cooking event so we will be making everything from scratch. Please bring your ingredients prepped and ready to go, to cut down on time in the kitchen. 

If you wish to drink with us, please also contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail.

I have a small 7lb hypo allergenic Yorkie Poo named Pepper, he is really sweet and loves people, but if you have an issue with dogs please refrain from RSVPing to this event.

The fine print: 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of Feb 13th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
Join us for the opening reception of Transcendetal Tactility, a multi-media exhibit by Norwegian artist-run space Prosjektrom Normanns. Transcendental Tactility will be on view at Open Source from February 11-27.

Transcendental Tactility is a group exhibition curated by Norwegian artist-run space Prosjektrom Normanns that will explore abstract, poetic, and lyric expressions of existence and presence. Showcasing works by Norwegian contemporary artists Per Christian Brown, Benedicte Clementsen, Elin Melberg, Margrethe Aanestad, and Kristin Velle-George, Transcendental Tactility will utilize a variety of media, such as film, painting, textile, sculpture, and drawing. Working with a shared interest in materiality and techniques, artists included in this exhibit will explore personal and universal experience through abstraction. Underlining sensibilities, tactility, and fragility inherent in materials, work included in this exhibit excavates timeless and subjective forms. Transcendental Tactility invites the audience to explore the subjective history within objects, their own subjective perceptions, and larger themes of time and presence.

Recognizing the contradictions within the artists’ work, Transcendental Tactility will serve to highlight the overlapping themes within their practices. Aanestads´ minimalist work revolves around form, spatiality and materiality, which she explores in a contemplative and abstract language. Melberg examines points of intersection–where is the line between being in control and losing control? How much can the materials take before they burst or fray? Placing greater focus on the psychology of color and material, Brown dwells on that which is hidden and exploring micro- and macro-cosms. Clementsen is interested in the man-made, exploring survival strategies and transition rituals that address existential questions, while Velle-George is occupied by the space between human knowledge and imagination, focusing on the physical and metaphysical concepts. An overarching theme of materiality pervades the show, but ultimately the collective narrative created by the artists is ambiguous and the viewer’s perspective and subjectivity becomes key in extracting meaning.

Open Source collaborated with Prosjektrom Normanns and the individual artists over several years, through various exhibitions and projects. Established in 2011, Prosjektrom Normanns is a non-profit exhibition space located in Stavanger, Norway. The project space is run by its members, artists Margrethe Aanestad, Kristin Velle-George, Elin Melberg. Prosjektrom Normanns exhibits both national and international artists, primarily focusing on site-specific exhibitions and exchange with spaces and initiatives across the globe. The group is active in collaborations with art institutions such as Kunsthall Stavanger, Rogaland Kunstsenter and Rogaland Art College. The Prosjektrom Normanns exhibition program is supported by the City of Stavanger, Rogaland County and the Norwegian Arts Council.

This exhibit is supported by the American Scandinavian Foundation

.

results.description:
An Academy Award nominee for Best Foreign Language Film, A War is the third bruising and brooding feature from writer/director Tobias Lindholm (A Hijacking, R). Company commander Claus M. Pedersen (Pilou Asbæk, Lucy, A Hijacking, R) and his men are stationed in an Afghan province. Meanwhile, back in Denmark, Claus’ wife Maria (Tuva Novotny) is trying to hold everyday life together with a husband at war and three children who are missing their father. During a routine mission, the soldiers are caught in heavy crossfire and in order to save his men, Claus makes a decision that ultimately sees him return to Denmark accused of a war crime. The film strives towards realism by employing those who have been closest to the conflict, using Danish soldiers and Taliban warriors, relatives and refugees. (Fully subtitled) 

Click here for the official site. 

https://youtu.be/Ay97SOH235I


Click here for an "anatomy of a scene."

Instructions

Please click here to buy your ticket.  Don't be sold-out!

The group will meet for dinner at Pala Pizza, 198 Allen St. at 5:30. Jonathan's reservation.  I won't be looking for people at the cinema. 

Give your fellow participants your attention by refraining from all phone usage.  

Please drink responsibly.

Breed Meetups 2016!

Every Saturday in 2016 School For The Dogs is hosting 90-minute breed meetups every week at our training center. We limit the number of dogs to ten. The cost is $20 per dog;members may attend for free.  Advance signup is highly encouraged. 


DETAILS
• Proof of Rabies vaccination is required. Dogs must be over 5-months old, unless otherwise authorized by School For The Dogs staff.
• Free coffee and wine is available for humans.

Below is our upcoming schedule of breeds. If you are interested in a meetup for a breed not listed below, or would like to do one on an alternate day, email us and we will see what we can do!

Robert Gilligan's beloved annual:

THE GATSBY WINTER BAll ( SOIRÉE)

You are invited to Celebrate in a Real Castle !

Yes, We rented the Entire Castle! the Gatsby Era will make its return to Lambert Castle. The Castle was built in 1892 as the home of Catalina Lambert, the owner of a prominent silk mill in the City of Paterson. Constructed in the Medieval Revival architectural style, Mr. Lambert's dream was to build a home reminiscent of the castles in Great Britain. President William McKinley and vice president Garret Hobart visited the castle in 1898.anniversary.

The Theme in 2016 is the beauty and glamour of the roaring twenties its revived. "Love is in the Air"

The J Taylor Leach SEXTET

Featuring- 


Bill Mobley- Trumpet
Nicole Glover- Tenor Saxophone
Kelly Green- Piano/ Vocals
Steve LaSpina- Bass
and myself on drums.

Plays a special songbook of Jazz and Swing , favorites for your dancing and listening pleasure.


Guest performances including Andrew C and and other surprises await.

We too can enjoy a Night of glitz and glamour and all that jazz!


The Castle provides the intimate yet splendorous setting.

This roaring twenties party will featuring live orchestras, performances, photo booth, vintage vendors, food and drink.


ADMISSION FEE : $125.00 pp

GENERAL ADMISSION TICKETS INCLUDE:

-Access to the event from: 7pm-11 pm

-Live performances, music, dancing and entertainment

-Tour of the Castle

-No waiting in line


-Photo booth w Pics included,

- Buffet Cocktail Party Dinner

- Prizes,

-All Soft Drinks -Coffee- Tea


And Just Added Custom Valentines Day Cupcakes From Mr. Cupcakes 

MR. CUPCAKES


(Josh recommends  them!) 


-2 -Drinks of choice (Champagne, Champagne Cocktails , Beer, Wine, )

Other Bar drinks Available for Purchase (Cash Bar)

The resurgence of The Great Gatsby has returned to NJ. Ladies put on your shiniest flapper dress and men dress in your stylish black tie and engage in a night of grandeur beyond your greatest imagination.

Indulge with your friends in opulent flowing towers of Champagne , delightful cocktails. and Perrier coupled with buffets filled delicious Desserts.

Party like the infamous Jay Gatsby for one night of extravagant celebration including live 1920s jazz, Band and performances, DJ also spinning electro swing and many more amazing, breathtaking, pop up surprises that will captivate your attention.

Join us for this level of glamorous debauchery and purchase your tickets now to experience the grandeur of the roaring twenties:

Formal attire requested- Masks are encouraged!

All guests must be 21 and over

Please send Payments Before this Event Go Public.

NJ Magazine and the NJ Bergen Record will Feature an Article about this Event.

Please send Payments to Robert Gilligan, PO Box 184, Ridgewood, NJ 07451

or w Paypal.com to [masked]

Please don't write Questions on the "wall" I don't see all of them.

Thanks for your Cooperation

Robert
